verse: When I looked for good, then evil came unto me: and when I waited for light, there came darkness.

name: Job 30:27
verse: My bowels boiled, and rested not: the days of affliction prevented me.

name: Job 30:28
verse: I went mourning without the sun: I stood up, and I cried in the congregation.

name: Job 30:29
verse: I am a brother to dragons, and a companion to owls.

name: Job 30:30
verse: My skin is black upon me, and my bones are burned with heat.

name: Job 30:31
verse: My harp also is turned to mourning, and my organ into the voice of them that weep.

name: Job 31:1
verse: I made a covenant with mine eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?

name: Job 31:2
verse: For what portion of God is there from above? and what inheritance of the Almighty from on high?

name: Job 31:3
verse: Is not destruction to the wicked? and a strange punishment to the workers of iniquity?

name: Job 31:4
verse: Doth not he see my ways, and count all my steps?

name: Job 31:5
verse: If I have walked with vanity, or if my foot hath hasted to deceit;

name: Job 31:6
verse: Let me be weighed in an even balance, that God may know mine integrity.

name: Job 31:7
verse: If my step hath turned out of the way, and mine heart walked after mine eyes, and if any blot hath cleaved to mine hands;

name: Job 31:8
verse: Then let me sow, and let another eat; yea, let my offspring be rooted out.

name: Job 31:9
verse: If mine heart have been deceived by a woman, or if I have laid wait at my neighbour's door;

name: Job 31:10
verse: Then let my wife grind unto another, and let others bow down upon her.

name: Job 31:11
verse: For this is an heinous crime; yea, it is an iniquity to be punished by the judges.

name: Job 31:12
verse: For it is a fire that consumeth to destruction, and would root out all mine increase.

name: Job 31:13
verse: If I did despise the cause of my manservant or of my maidservant, when they contended with me;

name: Job 31:14
verse: What then shall I do when God riseth up? and when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?

name: Job 31:15
verse: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? and did not one fashion us in the womb?

name: Job 31:16
verse: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail;

name: Job 31:17
verse: Or have eaten my morsel myself alone, and the fatherless hath not eaten thereof;

name: Job 31:18
verse: (For from my youth he was brought up with me, as with a father, and I have guided her from my mother's womb;)

name: Job 31:19
verse: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, or any poor without covering;

name: Job 31:20
verse: If his loins have not blessed me, and if he were not warmed with the fleece of my sheep;

name: Job 31:21
verse: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, when I saw my help in the gate:

name: Job 31:22
verse: Then let mine arm fall from my shoulder blade, and mine arm be broken from the bone.

name: Job 31:23
verse: For destruction from God was a terror to me, and by reason of his highness I could not endure.

name: Job 31:24
verse: If I have made gold my hope, or have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;

name: Job 31:25
verse: If I rejoiced because my wealth was great, and because mine hand had gotten much;

name: Job 31:26
verse: If I beheld the sun when it shined, or the moon walking in brightness;

name: Job 31:27
verse: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, or my mouth hath kissed my hand:

name: Job 31:28
verse: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judge: for I should have denied the God that is above.

name: Job 31:29
verse: If I rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, or lifted up myself when evil found him:

name: Job 31:30
verse: Neither have I suffered my mouth to sin by wishing a curse to his soul.

name: Job 31:31
verse: If the men of my tabernacle said not, Oh that we had of his flesh! we cannot be satisfied.

name: Job 31:32
verse: The stranger did not lodge in the street: but I opened my doors to the traveller.

name: Job 31:33
verse: If I covered my transgressions as Adam, by hiding mine iniquity in my bosom:

name: Job 31:34
verse: Did I fear a great multitude, or did the contempt of families terrify me, that I kept silence, and went not out of the door?

name: Job 31:35
verse: Oh that one would hear me! behold, my desire is, that the Almighty would answer me, and that mine adversary had written a book.

name: Job 31:36
verse: Surely I would take it upon my shoulder, and bind it as a crown to me.

name: Job 31:37
verse: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; as a prince would I go near unto him.

name: Job 31:38
verse: If my land cry against me, or that the furrows likewise thereof complain;

name: Job 31:39
verse: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:

name: Job 31:40
verse: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, and cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.

name: Job 32:1
verse: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.

name: Job 32:2
verse: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the kindred of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.

name: Job 32:3
verse: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

name: Job 32:4
verse: Now Elihu had waited till Job had spoken, because they were elder than he.

name: Job 32:5
verse: When Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, then his wrath was kindled.

name: Job 32:6
verse: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; wherefore I was afraid, and durst not shew you mine opinion.

name: Job 32:7
verse: I said, Days should speak, and multitude of years should teach wisdom.

name: Job 32:8
verse: But there is a spirit in man: and the inspiration of the Almighty giveth them understanding.

name: Job 32:9
verse: Great men are not always wise: neither do the aged understand judgment.

name: Job 32:10
verse: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will shew mine opinion.

name: Job 32:11
verse: Behold, I waited for your words; I gave ear to your reasons, whilst ye searched out what to say.

name: Job 32:12
verse: Yea, I attended unto you, and, behold, there was none of you that convinced Job, or that answered his words:

name: Job 32:13
verse: Lest ye should say, We have found out wisdom: God thrusteth him down, not man.

name: Job 32:14
verse: Now he hath not directed his words against me: neither will I answer him with your speeches.

name: Job 32:15
verse: They were amazed, they answered no more: they left off speaking.

name: Job 32:16
verse: When I had waited, (for they spake not, but stood still, and answered no more;)

name: Job 32:17
verse: I said, I will answer also my part, I also will shew mine opinion.

name: Job 32:18
verse: For I am full of matter, the spirit within me constraineth me.

name: Job 32:19
verse: Behold, my belly is as wine which hath no vent; it is ready to burst like new bottles.

name: Job 32:20
verse: I will speak, that I may be refreshed: I will open my lips and answer.

name: Job 32:21
verse: Let me not, I pray you, accept any man's person, neither let me give flattering titles unto man.

name: Job 32:22
verse: For I know not to give flattering titles; in so doing my maker would soon take me away.

name: Job 33:1
verse: Wherefore, Job, I pray thee, hear my speeches, and hearken to all my words.

name: Job 33:2
verse: Behold, now I have opened my mouth, my tongue hath spoken in my mouth.

name: Job 33:3
verse: My words shall be of the uprightness of my heart: and my lips shall utter knowledge clearly.

name: Job 33:4
verse: The Spirit of God hath made me, and the breath of the Almighty hath given me life.

name: Job 33:5
verse: If thou canst answer me, set thy words in order before me, stand up.

name: Job 33:6
verse: Behold, I am according to thy wish in God's stead: I also am formed out of the clay.

name: Job 33:7
verse: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, neither shall my hand be heavy upon thee.

name: Job 33:8
verse: Surely thou hast spoken in mine hearing, and I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,

name: Job 33:9
verse: I am clean without transgression, I am innocent; neither is there iniquity in me.

name: Job 33:10
verse: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, he counteth me for his enemy,

name: Job 33:11
verse: He putteth my feet in the stocks, he marketh all my paths.

name: Job 33:12
verse: Behold, in this thou art not just: I will answer thee, that God is greater than man.

name: Job 33:13
verse: Why dost thou strive against him? for he giveth not account of any of his matters.

name: Job 33:14
verse: For God speaketh once, yea twice, yet man perceiveth it not.

name: Job 33:15
verse: In a dream, in a vision of the night, when deep sleep falleth upon men, in slumberings upon the bed;

name: Job 33:16
verse: Then he openeth the ears of men, and sealeth their instruction,

name: Job 33:17
verse: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, and hide pride from man.

name: Job 33:18
verse: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, and his life from perishing by the sword.

name: Job 33:19
verse: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, and the multitude of his bones with strong pain:

name: Job 33:20
verse: So that his life abhorreth bread, and his soul dainty meat.

name: Job 33:21
verse: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; and his bones that were not seen stick out.

name: Job 33:22
verse: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the grave, and his life to the destroyers.

name: Job 33:23
verse: If there be a messenger with him, an interpreter, one among a thousand, to shew unto man his uprightness:

name: Job 33:24
verse: Then he is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit: I have found a ransom.

name: Job 33:25
verse: His flesh shall be fresher than a child's: he shall return to the days of his youth:

name: Job 33:26
verse: He shall pray unto God, and he will be favourable unto him: and he shall see his face with joy: for he will render unto man his righteousness.

name: Job 33:27
verse: He looketh upon men, and if any say, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, and it profited me not;

name: Job 33:28
verse: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit, and his life shall see the light.

name: Job 33:29
verse: Lo, all these things worketh God oftentimes with man,

name: Job 33:30
verse: To bring back his soul from the pit, to be enlightened with the light of the living.

name: Job 33:31
verse: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I will speak.

name: Job 33:32
verse: If thou hast any thing to say, answer me: speak, for I desire to justify thee.

name: Job 33:33
verse: If not, hearken unto me: hold thy peace, and I shall teach thee wisdom.

name: Job 34:1
verse: Furthermore Elihu answered and said,

name: Job 34:2
verse: Hear my words, O ye wise men; and give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.

name: Job 34:3
verse: For the ear trieth words, as the mouth tasteth meat.

name: Job 34:4
verse: Let us choose to us judgment: let us know among ourselves what is good.

name: Job 34:5
verse: For Job hath said, I am righteous: and God hath taken away my judgment.

name: Job 34:6
verse: Should I lie against my right? my wound is incurable without transgression.

name: Job 34:7
verse: What man is like Job, who drinketh up scorning like water?

name: Job 34:8
verse: Which goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, and walketh with wicked men.

name: Job 34:9
verse: For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing that he should delight himself with God.

name: Job 34:10
verse: Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: far be it from God, that he should do wickedness; and from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.

name: Job 34:11
verse: For the work of a man shall he render unto him, and cause every man to find according to his ways.

name: Job 34:12
verse: Yea, surely God will not do wickedly, neither will the Almighty pervert judgment.

name: Job 34:13
verse: Who hath given him a charge over the earth? or who hath disposed the whole world?

name: Job 34:14
verse: If he set his heart upon man, if he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;

name: Job 34:15
verse: All flesh shall perish together, and man shall turn again unto dust.

name: Job 34:16
verse: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: hearken to the voice of my words.

name: Job 34:17
verse: Shall even he that hateth right govern? and wilt thou condemn him that is most just?

name: Job 34:18
verse: Is it fit to say to a king, Thou art wicked? and to princes, Ye are ungodly?

name: Job 34:19
verse: How much less to him that accepteth not the persons of princes, nor regardeth the rich more than the poor? for they all are the work of his hands.

name: Job 34:20
verse: In a moment shall they die, and the people shall be troubled at midnight, and pass away: and the mighty shall be taken away without hand.

name: Job 34:21
verse: For his eyes are upon the ways of man, and he seeth all his goings.

name: Job 34:22
verse: There is no darkness, nor shadow of death, where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.

name: Job 34:23
verse: For he will not lay upon man more than right; that he should enter into judgment with God.

name: Job 34:24
verse: He shall break in pieces mighty men without number, and set others in their stead.

name: Job 34:25
verse: Therefore he knoweth their works, and he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.

name: Job 34:26
verse: He striketh them as wicked men in the open sight of others;

name: Job 34:27
verse: Because they turned back from him, and would not consider any of his ways:

name: Job 34:28
verse: So that they cause the cry of the poor to come unto him, and he heareth the cry of the afflicted.

name: Job 34:29
verse: When he giveth quietness, who then can make trouble? and when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? whether it be done against a nation, or against a man only:

name: Job 34:30
verse: That the hypocrite reign not, lest the people be ensnared.

name: Job 34:31
verse: Surely it is meet to be said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:

name: Job 34:32
verse: That which I see not teach thou me: if I have done iniquity, I will do no more.

name: Job 34:33
verse: Should it be according to thy mind? he will recompense it, whether thou refuse, or whether thou choose; and not I: therefore speak what thou knowest.

name: Job 34:34
verse: Let men of understanding tell me, and let a wise man hearken unto me.

name: Job 34:35
verse: Job hath spoken without knowledge, and his words were without wisdom.

name: Job 34:36
verse: My desire is that Job may be tried unto the end because of his answers for wicked men.

name: Job 34:37
verse: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin, he clappeth his hands among us, and multiplieth his words against God.

name: Job 35:1
verse: Elihu spake moreover, and said,

name: Job 35:2
verse: Thinkest thou this to be right, that thou saidst, My righteousness is more than God's?

name: Job 35:3
verse: For thou saidst, What advantage will it be unto thee? and, What profit shall I have, if I be cleansed from my sin?

name: Job 35:4
verse: I will answer thee, and thy companions with thee.

name: Job 35:5
verse: Look unto the heavens, and see; and behold the clouds which are higher than thou.

name: Job 35:6
verse: If thou sinnest, what doest thou against him? or if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?

name: Job 35:7
verse: If thou be righteous, what givest thou him? or what receiveth he of thine hand?

name: Job 35:8
verse: Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; and thy righteousness may profit the son of man.

name: Job 35:9
verse: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they make the oppressed to cry: they cry out by reason of the arm of the mighty.

name: Job 35:10
verse: But none saith, Where is God my maker, who giveth songs in the night;

name: Job 35:11
verse: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, and maketh us wiser than the fowls of heaven?

name: Job 35:12
verse: There they cry, but none giveth answer, because of the pride of evil men.

name: Job 35:13
verse: Surely God will not hear vanity, neither will the Almighty regard it.

name: Job 35:14
verse: Although thou sayest thou shalt not see him, yet judgment is before him; therefore trust thou in him.

name: Job 35:15
verse: But now, because it is not so, he hath visited in his anger; yet he knoweth it not in great extremity:

name: Job 35:16
verse: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplieth words without knowledge.

name: Job 36:1
verse: Elihu also proceeded, and said,

name: Job 36:2
verse: Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet to speak on God's behalf.

name: Job 36:3
verse: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

name: Job 36:4
verse: For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.

name: Job 36:5
verse: Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.

name: Job 36:6
verse: He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.

name: Job 36:7
verse: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

name: Job 36:8
verse: And if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;

name: Job 36:9
verse: Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.

name: Job 36:10
verse: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.

name: Job 36:11
verse: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

name: Job 36:12
verse: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

name: Job 36:13
verse: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.

name: Job 36:14
verse: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.

name: Job 36:15
verse: He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.

name: Job 36:16
verse: Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.

name: Job 36:17
verse: But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.

name: Job 36:18
verse: Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.

name: Job 36:19
verse: Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.

name: Job 36:20
verse: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.

name: Job 36:21
verse: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.

name: Job 36:22
verse: Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?

name: Job 36:23
verse: Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?

name: Job 36:24
verse: Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.

name: Job 36:25
verse: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.

name: Job 36:26
verse: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.

name: Job 36:27
verse: For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:

name: Job 36:28
verse: Which the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.

name: Job 36:29
verse: Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?

name: Job 36:30
verse: Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.

name: Job 36:31
verse: For by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abundance.

name: Job 36:32
verse: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.

name: Job 36:33
verse: The noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.

name: Job 37:1
verse: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.

name: Job 37:2
verse: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.

name: Job 37:3
verse: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.

name: Job 37:4
verse: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

name: Job 37:5
verse: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.

name: Job 37:6
verse: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.

name: Job 37:7
verse: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

name: Job 37:8
verse: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.

name: Job 37:9
verse: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.

name: Job 37:10
verse: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

name: Job 37:11
verse: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

name: Job 37:12
verse: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.

name: Job 37:13
verse: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.

name: Job 37:14
verse: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

name: Job 37:15
verse: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?

name: Job 37:16
verse: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?

name: Job 37:17
verse: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?

name: Job 37:18
verse: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?

name: Job 37:19
verse: Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

name: Job 37:20
verse: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.

name: Job 37:21
verse: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

name: Job 37:22
verse: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.

name: Job 37:23
verse: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.

name: Job 37:24
verse: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.

name: Job 38:1
verse: Then the LORD answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

name: Job 38:2
verse: Who is this that darkeneth counsel by words without knowledge?

name: Job 38:3
verse: Gird up now thy loins like a man; for I will demand of thee, and answer thou me.

name: Job 38:4
verse: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare, if thou hast understanding.

name: Job 38:5
verse: Who hath laid the measures thereof, if thou knowest? or who hath stretched the line upon it?

name: Job 38:6
verse: Whereupon are the foundations thereof fastened? or who laid the corner stone thereof;

name: Job 38:7
verse: When the morning stars sang together, and all the sons of God shouted for joy?

name: Job 38:8
verse: Or who shut up the sea with doors, when it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb?

name: Job 38:9
verse: When I made the cloud the garment thereof, and thick darkness a swaddlingband for it,

name: Job 38:10
verse: And brake up for it my decreed place, and set bars and doors,

name: Job 38:11
verse: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further: and here shall thy proud waves be stayed?

name: Job 38:12
verse: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days; and caused the dayspring to know his place;

name: Job 38:13
verse: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, that the wicked might be shaken out of it?

name: Job 38:14
verse: It is turned as clay to the seal; and they stand as a garment.

name: Job 38:15
verse: And from the wicked their light is withholden, and the high arm shall be broken.

name: Job 38:16
verse: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? or hast thou walked in the search of the depth?

name: Job 38:17
verse: Have the gates of death been opened unto thee? or hast thou seen the doors of the shadow of death?

name: Job 38:18
verse: Hast thou perceived the breadth of the earth? declare if thou knowest it all.

name: Job 38:19
verse: Where is the way where light dwelleth? and as for darkness, where is the place thereof,

name: Job 38:20
verse: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, and that thou shouldest know the paths to the house thereof?

name: Job 38:21
verse: Knowest thou it, because thou wast then born? or because the number of thy days is great?

name: Job 38:22
verse: Hast thou entered into the treasures of the snow? or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,

name: Job 38:23
verse: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, against the day of battle and war?

name: Job 38:24
verse: By what way is the light parted, which scattereth the east wind upon the earth?

name: Job 38:25
verse: Who hath divided a watercourse for the overflowing of waters, or a way for the lightning of thunder;

name: Job 38:26
verse: To cause it to rain on the earth, where no man is; on the wilderness, wherein there is no man;

name: Job 38:27
verse: To satisfy the desolate and waste ground; and to cause the bud of the tender herb to spring forth?

name: Job 38:28
verse: Hath the rain a father? or who hath begotten the drops of dew?

name: Job 38:29
verse: Out of whose womb came the ice? and the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?

name: Job 38:30
verse: The waters are hid as with a stone, and the face of the deep is frozen.

name: Job 38:31
verse: Canst thou bind the sweet influences of Pleiades, or loose the bands of Orion?

name: Job 38:32
verse: Canst thou bring forth Mazzaroth in his season? or canst thou guide Arcturus with his sons?

name: Job 38:33
verse: Knowest thou the ordinances of heaven? canst thou set the dominion thereof in the earth?

name: Job 38:34
verse: Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds, that abundance of waters may cover thee?

name: Job 38:35
verse: Canst thou send lightnings, that they may go, and say unto thee, Here we are?

name: Job 38:36
verse: Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts? or who hath given understanding to the heart?

name: Job 38:37
verse: Who can number the clouds in wisdom? or who can stay the bottles of heaven,

name: Job 38:38
verse: When the dust groweth into hardness, and the clods cleave fast together?

name: Job 38:39
verse: Wilt thou hunt the prey for the lion? or fill the appetite of the young lions,

name: Job 38:40
verse: When they couch in their dens, and abide in the covert to lie in wait?

name: Job 38:41
verse: Who provideth for the raven his food? when his young ones cry unto God, they wander for lack of meat.

name: Job 39:1
verse: Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?

name: Job 39:2
verse: Canst thou number the months that they fulfil? or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?

name: Job 39:3
verse: They bow themselves, they bring forth their young ones, they cast out their sorrows.

name: Job 39:4
verse: Their young ones are in good liking, they grow up with corn; they go forth, and return not unto them.

name: Job 39:5
verse: Who hath sent out the wild ass free? or who hath loosed the bands of the wild ass?

name: Job 39:6
verse: Whose house I have made the wilderness, and the barren land his dwellings.

name: Job 39:7
verse: He scorneth the multitude of the city, neither regardeth he the crying of the driver.

name: Job 39:8
verse: The range of the mountains is his pasture, and he searcheth after every green thing.

name: Job 39:9
verse: Will the unicorn be willing to serve thee, or abide by thy crib?

name: Job 39:10
verse: Canst thou bind the unicorn with his band in the furrow? or will he harrow the valleys after thee?

name: Job 39:11
verse: Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great? or wilt thou leave thy labour to him?

name: Job 39:12
verse: Wilt thou believe him, that he will bring home thy seed, and gather it into thy barn?

name: Job 39:13
verse: Gavest thou the goodly wings unto the peacocks? or wings and feathers unto the ostrich?

name: Job 39:14
verse: Which leaveth her eggs in the earth, and warmeth them in dust,

name: Job 39:15
verse: And forgetteth that the foot may crush them, or that the wild beast may break them.

name: Job 39:16
verse: She is hardened against her young ones, as though they were not hers: her labour is in vain without fear;

name: Job 39:17
verse: Because God hath deprived her of wisdom, neither hath he imparted to her understanding.

name: Job 39:18
verse: What time she lifteth up herself on high, she scorneth the horse and his rider.

name: Job 39:19
verse: Hast thou given the horse strength? hast thou clothed his neck with thunder?

name: Job 39:20
verse: Canst thou make him afraid as a grasshopper? the glory of his nostrils is terrible.

name: Job 39:21
verse: He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength: he goeth on to meet the armed men.

name: Job 39:22
verse: He mocketh at fear, and is not affrighted; neither turneth he back from the sword.

name: Job 39:23
verse: The quiver rattleth against him, the glittering spear and the shield.

name: Job 39:24
verse: He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage: neither believeth he that it is the sound of the trumpet.

name: Job 39:25
verse: He saith among the trumpets, Ha, ha; and he smelleth the battle afar off, the thunder of the captains, and the shouting.

name: Job 39:26
verse: Doth the hawk fly by thy wisdom, and stretch her wings toward the south?

name: Job 39:27
verse: Doth the eagle mount up at thy command, and make her nest on high?

name: Job 39:28
verse: She dwelleth and abideth on the rock, upon the crag of the rock, and the strong place.

name: Job 39:29
verse: From thence she seeketh the prey, and her eyes behold afar off.

name: Job 39:30
verse: Her young ones also suck up blood: and where the slain are, there is she.

name: Job 40:1
verse: Moreover the LORD answered Job, and said,

name: Job 40:2
verse: Shall he that contendeth with the Almighty instruct him? he that reproveth God, let him answer it.

name: Job 40:3
verse: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,

name: Job 40:4
verse: Behold, I am vile; what shall I answer thee? I will lay mine hand upon my mouth.

name: Job 40:5
verse: Once have I spoken; but I will not answer: yea, twice; but I will proceed no further.

name: Job 40:6
verse: Then answered the LORD unto Job out of the whirlwind, and said,

name: Job 40:7
verse: Gird up thy loins now like a man: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

name: Job 40:8
verse: Wilt thou also disannul my judgment? wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be righteous?

name: Job 40:9
verse: Hast thou an arm like God? or canst thou thunder with a voice like him?

name: Job 40:10
verse: Deck thyself now with majesty and excellency; and array thyself with glory and beauty.

name: Job 40:11
verse: Cast abroad the rage of thy wrath: and behold every one that is proud, and abase him.

name: Job 40:12
verse: Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low; and tread down the wicked in their place.

name: Job 40:13
verse: Hide them in the dust together; and bind their faces in secret.

name: Job 40:14
verse: Then will I also confess unto thee that thine own right hand can save thee.

name: Job 40:15
verse: Behold now behemoth, which I made with thee; he eateth grass as an ox.

name: Job 40:16
verse: Lo now, his strength is in his loins, and his force is in the navel of his belly.

name: Job 40:17
verse: He moveth his tail like a cedar: the sinews of his stones are wrapped together.

name: Job 40:18
verse: His bones are as strong pieces of brass; his bones are like bars of iron.

name: Job 40:19
verse: He is the chief of the ways of God: he that made him can make his sword to approach unto him.

name: Job 40:20
verse: Surely the mountains bring him forth food, where all the beasts of the field play.

name: Job 40:21
verse: He lieth under the shady trees, in the covert of the reed, and fens.

name: Job 40:22
verse: The shady trees cover him with their shadow; the willows of the brook compass him about.

name: Job 40:23
verse: Behold, he drinketh up a river, and hasteth not: he trusteth that he can draw up Jordan into his mouth.

name: Job 40:24
verse: He taketh it with his eyes: his nose pierceth through snares.

name: Job 41:1
verse: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?

name: Job 41:2
verse: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?

name: Job 41:3
verse: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?

name: Job 41:4
verse: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?

name: Job 41:5
verse: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?

name: Job 41:6
verse: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?

name: Job 41:7
verse: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?

name: Job 41:8
verse: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.

name: Job 41:9
verse: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?

name: Job 41:10
verse: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?

name: Job 41:11
verse: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.

name: Job 41:12
verse: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.

name: Job 41:13
verse: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?

name: Job 41:14
verse: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.

name: Job 41:15
verse: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.

name: Job 41:16
verse: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.

name: Job 41:17
verse: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.

name: Job 41:18
verse: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

name: Job 41:19
verse: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.

name: Job 41:20
verse: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.

name: Job 41:21
verse: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.

name: Job 41:22
verse: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.

name: Job 41:23
verse: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.

name: Job 41:24
verse: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.

name: Job 41:25
verse: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.

name: Job 41:26
verse: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.

name: Job 41:27
verse: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.

name: Job 41:28
verse: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.

name: Job 41:29
verse: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.

name: Job 41:30
verse: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.

name: Job 41:31
verse: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.

name: Job 41:32
verse: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.

name: Job 41:33
verse: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.

name: Job 41:34
verse: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.

name: Job 42:1
verse: Then Job answered the LORD, and said,

name: Job 42:2
verse: I know that thou canst do every thing, and that no thought can be withholden from thee.

name: Job 42:3
verse: Who is he that hideth counsel without knowledge? therefore have I uttered that I understood not; things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.

name: Job 42:4
verse: Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak: I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.

name: Job 42:5
verse: I have heard of thee by the hearing of the ear: but now mine eye seeth thee.

name: Job 42:6
verse: Wherefore I abhor myself, and repent in dust and ashes.

name: Job 42:7
verse: And it was so, that after the LORD had spoken these words unto Job, the LORD said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends: for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.

name: Job 42:8
verse: Therefore take unto you now seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you: for him will I accept: lest I deal with you after your folly, in that ye have not spoken of me the thing which is right, like my servant Job.

name: Job 42:9
verse: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as the LORD commanded them: the LORD also accepted Job.

name: Job 42:10
verse: And the LORD turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: also the LORD gave Job twice as much as he had before.

name: Job 42:11
verse: Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house: and they bemoaned him, and comforted him over all the evil that the LORD had brought upon him: every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one an earring of gold.

name: Job 42:12
verse: So the LORD blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning: for he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she asses.

name: Job 42:13
verse: He had also seven sons and three daughters.

name: Job 42:14
verse: And he called the name of the first, Jemima; and the name of the second, Kezia; and the name of the third, Keren-happuch.

name: Job 42:15
verse: And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.

name: Job 42:16
verse: After this lived Job an hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons' sons, even four generations.

name: Job 42:17
verse: So Job died, being old and full of days.

name: Psalms 1:1
verse: Blessed is the man that walketh not in the counsel of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the seat of the scornful.

name: Psalms 1:2
verse: But his delight is in the law of the LORD; and in his law doth he meditate day and night.

name: Psalms 1:3
verse: And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water, that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.

name: Psalms 1:4
verse: The ungodly are not so: but are like the chaff which the wind driveth away.

name: Psalms 1:5
verse: Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment, nor sinners in the congregation of the righteous.

name: Psalms 1:6
verse: For the LORD knoweth the way of the righteous: but the way of the ungodly shall perish.

name: Psalms 2:1
verse: Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?

name: Psalms 2:2
verse: The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the LORD, and against his anointed, saying,

name: Psalms 2:3
verse: Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.

name: Psalms 2:4
verse: He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in derision.

name: Psalms 2:5
verse: Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore displeasure.

name: Psalms 2:6
verse: Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.

name: Psalms 2:7
verse: I will declare the decree: the LORD hath said unto me, Thou art my Son; this day have I begotten thee.

name: Psalms 2:8
verse: Ask of me, and I shall give thee the heathen for thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth for thy possession.

name: Psalms 2:9
verse: Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in pieces like a potter's vessel.

name: Psalms 2:10
verse: Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges of the earth.

name: Psalms 2:11
verse: Serve the LORD with fear, and rejoice with trembling.

name: Psalms 2:12
verse: Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish from the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed are all they that put their trust in him.

name: Psalms 3:1
verse: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! many are they that rise up against me.

name: Psalms 3:2
verse: Many there be which say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.

name: Psalms 3:3
verse: But thou, O LORD, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.

name: Psalms 3:4
verse: I cried unto the LORD with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.

name: Psalms 3:5
verse: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the LORD sustained me.

name: Psalms 3:6
verse: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.

name: Psalms 3:7
verse: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

name: Psalms 3:8
verse: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.

name: Psalms 4:1
verse: Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me when I was in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my prayer.

name: Psalms 4:2
verse: O ye sons of men, how long will ye turn my glory into shame? how long will ye love vanity, and seek after leasing? Selah.

name: Psalms 4:3
verse: But know that the LORD hath set apart him that is godly for himself: the LORD will hear when I call unto him.

name: Psalms 4:4
verse: Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your bed, and be still. Selah.

name: Psalms 4:5
verse: Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the LORD.

name: Psalms 4:6
verse: There be many that say, Who will shew us any good? LORD, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.

name: Psalms 4:7
verse: Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time that their corn and their wine increased.

name: Psalms 4:8
verse: I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, LORD, only makest me dwell in safety.

name: Psalms 5:1
verse: Give ear to my words, O LORD, consider my meditation.

name: Psalms 5:2
verse: Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I pray.

name: Psalms 5:3
verse: My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O LORD; in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee, and will look up.

name: Psalms 5:4
verse: For thou art not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness: neither shall evil dwell with thee.

name: Psalms 5:5
verse: The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers of iniquity.

name: Psalms 5:6
verse: Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the LORD will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.

name: Psalms 5:7
verse: But as for me, I will come into thy house in the multitude of thy mercy: and in thy fear will I worship toward thy holy temple.

name: Psalms 5:8
verse: Lead me, O LORD, in thy righteousness because of mine enemies; make thy way straight before my face.

name: Psalms 5:9
verse: For there is no faithfulness in their mouth; their inward part is very wickedness; their throat is an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.

name: Psalms 5:10
verse: Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels; cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have rebelled against thee.

name: Psalms 5:11
verse: But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that love thy name be joyful in thee.

name: Psalms 5:12
verse: For thou, LORD, wilt bless the righteous; with favour wilt thou compass him as with a shield.

name: Psalms 6:1
verse: O LORD, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten me in thy hot displeasure.

name: Psalms 6:2
verse: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; for I am weak: O LORD, heal me; for my bones are vexed.

name: Psalms 6:3
verse: My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O LORD, how long?

name: Psalms 6:4
verse: Return, O LORD, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy mercies' sake.

name: Psalms 6:5
verse: For in death there is no remembrance of thee: in the grave who shall give thee thanks?

name: Psalms 6:6
verse: I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to swim; I water my couch with my tears.

name: Psalms 6:7
verse: Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine enemies.

name: Psalms 6:8
verse: Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the LORD hath heard the voice of my weeping.

name: Psalms 6:9
verse: The LORD hath heard my supplication; the LORD will receive my prayer.

name: Psalms 6:10
verse: Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return and be ashamed suddenly.

name: Psalms 7:1
verse: O LORD my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:

name: Psalms 7:2
verse: Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.

name: Psalms 7:3
verse: O LORD my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;

name: Psalms 7:4
verse: If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)

name: Psalms 7:5
verse: Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.

name: Psalms 7:6
verse: Arise, O LORD, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.

name: Psalms 7:7
verse: So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.

name: Psalms 7:8
verse: The LORD shall judge the people: judge me, O LORD, according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.

name: Psalms 7:9
verse: Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.

name: Psalms 7:10
verse: My defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.

name: Psalms 7:11
verse: God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.

name: Psalms 7:12
verse: If he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.

name: Psalms 7:13
verse: He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.

name: Psalms 7:14
verse: Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.

name: Psalms 7:15
verse: He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.

name: Psalms 7:16
verse: His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.

name: Psalms 7:17
verse: I will praise the LORD according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the LORD most high.

name: Psalms 8:1
verse: O LORD our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth! who hast set thy glory above the heavens.

name: Psalms 8:2
verse: Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained strength because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy and the avenger.

name: Psalms 8:3
verse: When I consider thy heavens, the work of thy fingers, the moon and the stars, which thou hast ordained;

name: Psalms 8:4
verse: What is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man, that thou visitest him?

name: Psalms 8:5
verse: For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels, and hast crowned him with glory and honour.

name: Psalms 8:6
verse: Thou madest him to have dominion over the works of thy hands; thou hast put all things under his feet:

name: Psalms 8:7
verse: All sheep and oxen, yea, and the beasts of the field;

name: Psalms 8:8
verse: The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, and whatsoever passeth through the paths of the seas.

name: Psalms 8:9
verse: O LORD our Lord, how excellent is thy name in all the earth!

name: Psalms 9:1
verse: I will praise thee, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.

name: Psalms 9:2
verse: I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.

name: Psalms 9:3
verse: When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.

name: Psalms 9:4
verse: For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.

name: Psalms 9:5
verse: Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

name: Psalms 9:6
verse: O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.

name: Psalms 9:7
verse: But the LORD shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.

name: Psalms 9:8
verse: And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.

name: Psalms 9:9
verse: The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.

name: Psalms 9:10
verse: And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, LORD, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.

name: Psalms 9:11
verse: Sing praises to the LORD, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.

name: Psalms 9:12
verse: When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.

name: Psalms 9:13
verse: Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider my trouble which I suffer of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:

name: Psalms 9:14
verse: That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.

name: Psalms 9:15
verse: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.

name: Psalms 9:16
verse: The LORD is known by the judgment which he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.

name: Psalms 9:17
verse: The wicked shall be turned into hell, and all the nations that forget God.

name: Psalms 9:18
verse: For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall not perish for ever.

name: Psalms 9:19
verse: Arise, O LORD; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.

name: Psalms 9:20
verse: Put them in fear, O LORD: that the nations may know themselves to be but men. Selah.

name: Psalms 10:1
verse: Why standest thou afar off, O LORD? why hidest thou thyself in times of trouble?

name: Psalms 10:2
verse: The wicked in his pride doth persecute the poor: let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.

name: Psalms 10:3
verse: For the wicked boasteth of his heart's desire, and blesseth the covetous, whom the LORD abhorreth.

name: Psalms 10:4
verse: The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.

name: Psalms 10:5
verse: His ways are always grievous; thy judgments are far above out of his sight: as for all his enemies, he puffeth at them.

name: Psalms 10:6
verse: He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for I shall never be in adversity.

name: Psalms 10:7
verse: His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his tongue is mischief and vanity.

name: Psalms 10:8
verse: He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the poor.

name: Psalms 10:9
verse: He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his net.

name: Psalms 10:10
verse: He croucheth, and humbleth himself, that the poor may fall by his strong ones.

name: Psalms 10:11
verse: He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his face; he will never see it.

name: Psalms 10:12
verse: Arise, O LORD; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the humble.

name: Psalms 10:13
verse: Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his heart, Thou wilt not require it.

name: Psalms 10:14
verse: Thou hast seen it; for thou beholdest mischief and spite, to requite it with thy hand: the poor committeth himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.

name: Psalms 10:15
verse: Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil man: seek out his wickedness till thou find none.

name: Psalms 10:16
verse: The LORD is King for ever and ever: the heathen are perished out of his land.

name: Psalms 10:17
verse: LORD, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:

name: Psalms 10:18
verse: To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the earth may no more oppress.

name: Psalms 11:1
verse: In the LORD put I my trust: how say ye to my soul, Flee as a bird to your mountain?

name: Psalms 11:2
verse: For, lo, the wicked bend their bow, they make ready their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright in heart.

name: Psalms 11:3
verse: If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?

name: Psalms 11:4
verse: The LORD is in his holy temple, the LORD'S throne is in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try, the children of men.

name: Psalms 11:5
verse: The LORD trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that loveth violence his soul hateth.

name: Psalms 11:6
verse: Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an horrible tempest: this shall be the portion of their cup.

name: Psalms 11:7
verse: For the righteous LORD loveth righteousness; his countenance doth behold the upright.

name: Psalms 12:1
verse: Help, LORD; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.

name: Psalms 12:2
verse: They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: with flattering lips and with a double heart do they speak.

name: Psalms 12:3
verse: The LORD shall cut off all flattering lips, and the tongue that speaketh proud things:

name: Psalms 12:4
verse: Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips are our own: who is lord over us?

name: Psalms 12:5
verse: For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy, now will I arise, saith the LORD; I will set him in safety from him that puffeth at him.

name: Psalms 12:6
verse: The words of the LORD are pure words: as silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times.

name: Psalms 12:7
verse: Thou shalt keep them, O LORD, thou shalt preserve them from this generation for ever.

name: Psalms 12:8
verse: The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.

name: Psalms 13:1
verse: How long wilt thou forget me, O LORD? for ever? how long wilt thou hide thy face from me?

name: Psalms 13:2
verse: How long shall I take counsel in my soul, having sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?

name: Psalms 13:3
verse: Consider and hear me, O LORD my God: lighten mine eyes, lest I sleep the sleep of death;

name: Psalms 13:4
verse: Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; and those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved.

name: Psalms 13:5
verse: But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy salvation.

name: Psalms 13:6
verse: I will sing unto the LORD, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.

name: Psalms 14:1
verse: The fool hath said in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, there is none that doeth good.

name: Psalms 14:2
verse: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men, to see if there were any that did understand, and seek God.

name: Psalms 14:3
verse: They are all gone aside, they are all together become filthy: there is none that doeth good, no, not one.

name: Psalms 14:4
verse: Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my people as they eat bread, and call not upon the LORD.

name: Psalms 14:5
verse: There were they in great fear: for God is in the generation of the righteous.

name: Psalms 14:6
verse: Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the LORD is his refuge.

name: Psalms 14:7
verse: Oh that the salvation of Israel were come out of Zion! when the LORD bringeth back the captivity of his people, Jacob shall rejoice, and Israel shall be glad.

name: Psalms 15:1
verse: LORD, who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall dwell in thy holy hill?

name: Psalms 15:2
verse: He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and speaketh the truth in his heart.

name: Psalms 15:3
verse: He that backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth evil to his neighbour, nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbour.

name: Psalms 15:4
verse: In whose eyes a vile person is contemned; but he honoureth them that fear the LORD. He that sweareth to his own hurt, and changeth not.

name: Psalms 15:5
verse: He that putteth not out his money to usury, nor taketh reward against the innocent. He that doeth these things shall never be moved.

name: Psalms 16:1
verse: Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.

name: Psalms 16:2
verse: O my soul, thou hast said unto the LORD, Thou art my Lord: my goodness extendeth not to thee;

name: Psalms 16:3
verse: But to the saints that are in the earth, and to the excellent, in whom is all my delight.

name: Psalms 16:4
verse: Their sorrows shall be multiplied that hasten after another god: their drink offerings of blood will I not offer, nor take up their names into my lips.

name: Psalms 16:5
verse: The LORD is the portion of mine inheritance and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.

name: Psalms 16:6
verse: The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant places; yea, I have a goodly heritage.

name: Psalms 16:7
verse: I will bless the LORD, who hath given me counsel: my reins also instruct me in the night seasons.

name: Psalms 16:8
verse: I have set the LORD always before me: because he is at my right hand, I shall not be moved.

name: Psalms 16:9
verse: Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh also shall rest in hope.

name: Psalms 16:10
verse: For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou suffer thine Holy One to see corruption.

name: Psalms 16:11
verse: Thou wilt shew me the path of life: in thy presence is fulness of joy; at thy right hand there are pleasures for evermore.

name: Psalms 17:1
verse: Hear the right, O LORD, attend unto my cry, give ear unto my prayer, that goeth not out of feigned lips.

name: Psalms 17:2
verse: Let my sentence come forth from thy presence; let thine eyes behold the things that are equal.

name: Psalms 17:3
verse: Thou hast proved mine heart; thou hast visited me in the night; thou hast tried me, and shalt find nothing; I am purposed that my mouth shall not transgress.

name: Psalms 17:4
verse: Concerning the works of men, by the word of thy lips I have kept me from the paths of the destroyer.

name: Psalms 17:5
verse: Hold up my goings in thy paths, that my footsteps slip not.

name: Psalms 17:6
verse: I have called upon thee, for thou wilt hear me, O God: incline thine ear unto me, and hear my speech.

name: Psalms 17:7
verse: Shew thy marvellous lovingkindness, O thou that savest by thy right hand them which put their trust in thee from those that rise up against them.

name: Psalms 17:8
verse: Keep me as the apple of the eye, hide me under the shadow of thy wings,

name: Psalms 17:9
verse: From the wicked that oppress me, from my deadly enemies, who compass me about.

name: Psalms 17:10
verse: They are inclosed in their own fat: with their mouth they speak proudly.

name: Psalms 17:11
verse: They have now compassed us in our steps: they have set their eyes bowing down to the earth;

name: Psalms 17:12
verse: Like as a lion that is greedy of his prey, and as it were a young lion lurking in secret places.

name: Psalms 17:13
verse: Arise, O LORD, disappoint him, cast him down: deliver my soul from the wicked, which is thy sword:

name: Psalms 17:14
verse: From men which are thy hand, O LORD, from men of the world, which have their portion in this life, and whose belly thou fillest with thy hid treasure: they are full of children, and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.

name: Psalms 17:15
verse: As for me, I will behold thy face in righteousness: I shall be satisfied, when I awake, with thy likeness.

name: Psalms 18:1
verse: I will love thee, O LORD, my strength.

name: Psalms 18:2
verse: The LORD is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer; my God, my strength, in whom I will trust; my buckler, and the horn of my salvation, and my high tower.

name: Psalms 18:3
verse: I will call upon the LORD, who is worthy to be praised: so shall I be saved from mine enemies.

name: Psalms 18:4
verse: The sorrows of death compassed me, and the floods of ungodly men made me afraid.

name: Psalms 18:5
verse: The sorrows of hell compassed me about: the snares of death prevented me.

name: Psalms 18:6
verse: In my distress I called upon the LORD, and cried unto my God: he heard my voice out of his temple, and my cry came before him, even into his ears.

name: Psalms 18:7
verse: Then the earth shook and trembled; the foundations also of the hills moved and were shaken, because he was wroth.

name: Psalms 18:8
verse: There went up a smoke out of his nostrils, and fire out of his mouth devoured: coals were kindled by it.

name: Psalms 18:9
verse: He bowed the heavens also, and came down: and darkness was under his feet.

name: Psalms 18:10
verse: And he rode upon a cherub, and did fly: yea, he did fly upon the wings of the wind.

name: Psalms 18:11
verse: He made darkness his secret place; his pavilion round about him were dark waters and thick clouds of the skies.

name: Psalms 18:12
verse: At the brightness that was before him his thick clouds passed, hail stones and coals of fire.

name: Psalms 18:13
verse: The LORD also thundered in the heavens, and the Highest gave his voice; hail stones and coals of fire.

name: Psalms 18:14
verse: Yea, he sent out his arrows, and scattered them; and he shot out lightnings, and discomfited them.

name: Psalms 18:15
verse: Then the channels of waters were seen, and the foundations of the world were discovered at thy rebuke, O LORD, at the blast of the breath of thy nostrils.

name: Psalms 18:16
verse: He sent from above, he took me, he drew me out of many waters.

name: Psalms 18:17
verse: He delivered me from my strong enemy, and from them which hated me: for they were too strong for me.

name: Psalms 18:18
verse: They prevented me in the day of my calamity: but the LORD was my stay.

name: Psalms 18:19
verse: He brought me forth also into a large place; he delivered me, because he delighted in me.

name: Psalms 18:20
verse: The LORD rewarded me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands hath he recompensed me.

name: Psalms 18:21
verse: For I have kept the ways of the LORD, and have not wickedly departed from my God.

name: Psalms 18:22
verse: For all his judgments were before me, and I did not put away his statutes from me.

name: Psalms 18:23
verse: I was also upright before him, and I kept myself from mine iniquity.

name: Psalms 18:24
verse: Therefore hath the LORD recompensed me according to my righteousness, according to the cleanness of my hands in his eyesight.

name: Psalms 18:25
verse: With the merciful thou wilt shew thyself merciful; with an upright man thou wilt shew thyself upright;

name: Psalms 18:26
verse: With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward thou wilt shew thyself froward.

name: Psalms 18:27
verse: For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt bring down high looks.

name: Psalms 18:28
verse: For thou wilt light my candle: the LORD my God will enlighten my darkness.

name: Psalms 18:29
verse: For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped over a wall.

name: Psalms 18:30
verse: As for God, his way is perfect: the word of the LORD is tried: he is a buckler to all those that trust in him.

name: Psalms 18:31
verse: For who is God save the LORD? or who is a rock save our God?

name: Psalms 18:32
verse: It is God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh my way perfect.

name: Psalms 18:33
verse: He maketh my feet like hinds' feet, and setteth me upon my high places.

name: Psalms 18:34
verse: He teacheth my hands to war, so that a bow of steel is broken by mine arms.

name: Psalms 18:35
verse: Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right hand hath holden me up, and thy gentleness hath made me great.

name: Psalms 18:36
verse: Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, that my feet did not slip.

name: Psalms 18:37
verse: I have pursued mine enemies, and overtaken them: neither did I turn again till they were consumed.

name: Psalms 18:38
verse: I have wounded them that they were not able to rise: they are fallen under my feet.

name: Psalms 18:39
verse: For thou hast girded me with strength unto the battle: thou hast subdued under me those that rose up against me.

name: Psalms 18:40
verse: Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might destroy them that hate me.

name: Psalms 18:41
verse: They cried, but there was none to save them: even unto the LORD, but he answered them not.

name: Psalms 18:42
verse: Then did I beat them small as the dust before the wind: I did cast them out as the dirt in the streets.

name: Psalms 18:43
verse: Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; and thou hast made me the head of the heathen: a people whom I have not known shall serve me.

name: Psalms 18:44
verse: As soon as they hear of me, they shall obey me: the strangers shall submit themselves unto me.

name: Psalms 18:45
verse: The strangers shall fade away, and be afraid out of their close places.

name: Psalms 18:46
verse: The LORD liveth; and blessed be my rock; and let the God of my salvation be exalted.

name: Psalms 18:47
verse: It is God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under me.

name: Psalms 18:48
verse: He delivereth me from mine enemies: yea, thou liftest me up above those that rise up against me: thou hast delivered me from the violent man.

name: Psalms 18:49
verse: Therefore will I give thanks unto thee, O LORD, among the heathen, and sing praises unto thy name.

name: Psalms 18:50
verse: Great deliverance giveth he to his king; and sheweth mercy to his anointed, to David, and to his seed for evermore.

name: Psalms 19:1
verse: The heavens declare the glory of God; and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

name: Psalms 19:2
verse: Day unto day uttereth speech, and night unto night sheweth knowledge.

name: Psalms 19:3
verse: There is no speech nor language, where their voice is not heard.

name: Psalms 19:4
verse: Their line is gone out through all the earth, and their words to the end of the world. In them hath he set a tabernacle for the sun,

name: Psalms 19:5
verse: Which is as a bridegroom coming out of his chamber, and rejoiceth as a strong man to run a race.

name: Psalms 19:6
verse: His going forth is from the end of the heaven, and his circuit unto the ends of it: and there is nothing hid from the heat thereof.

name: Psalms 19:7
verse: The law of the LORD is perfect, converting the soul: the testimony of the LORD is sure, making wise the simple.

name: Psalms 19:8
verse: The statutes of the LORD are right, rejoicing the heart: the commandment of the LORD is pure, enlightening the eyes.

name: Psalms 19:9
verse: The fear of the LORD is clean, enduring for ever: the judgments of the LORD are true and righteous altogether.

name: Psalms 19:10
verse: More to be desired are they than gold, yea, than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.

name: Psalms 19:11
verse: Moreover by them is thy servant warned: and in keeping of them there is great reward.

name: Psalms 19:12
verse: Who can understand his errors? cleanse thou me from secret faults.

name: Psalms 19:13
verse: Keep back thy servant also from presumptuous sins; let them not have dominion over me: then shall I be upright, and I shall be innocent from the great transgression.

name: Psalms 19:14
verse: Let the words of my mouth, and the meditation of my heart, be acceptable in thy sight, O LORD, my strength, and my redeemer.

name: Psalms 20:1
verse: The LORD hear thee in the day of trouble; the name of the God of Jacob defend thee;

name: Psalms 20:2
verse: Send thee help from the sanctuary, and strengthen thee out of Zion;

name: Psalms 20:3
verse: Remember all thy offerings, and accept thy burnt sacrifice; Selah.

name: Psalms 20:4
verse: Grant thee according to thine own heart, and fulfil all thy counsel.

name: Psalms 20:5
verse: We will rejoice in thy salvation, and in the name of our God we will set up our banners: the LORD fulfil all thy petitions.

name: Psalms 20:6
verse: Now know I that the LORD saveth his anointed; he will hear him from his holy heaven with the saving strength of his right hand.

name: Psalms 20:7
verse: Some trust in chariots, and some in horses: but we will remember the name of the LORD our God.

name: Psalms 20:8
verse: They are brought down and fallen: but we are risen, and stand upright.

name: Psalms 20:9
verse: Save, LORD: let the king hear us when we call.

name: Psalms 21:1
verse: The king shall joy in thy strength, O LORD; and in thy salvation how greatly shall he rejoice!

name: Psalms 21:2
verse: Thou hast given him his heart's desire, and hast not withholden the request of his lips. Selah.

name: Psalms 21:3
verse: For thou preventest him with the blessings of goodness: thou settest a crown of pure gold on his head.

name: Psalms 21:4
verse: He asked life of thee, and thou gavest it him, even length of days for ever and ever.

name: Psalms 21:5
verse: His glory is great in thy salvation: honour and majesty hast thou laid upon him.

name: Psalms 21:6
verse: For thou hast made him most blessed for ever: thou hast made him exceeding glad with thy countenance.

name: Psalms 21:7
verse: For the king trusteth in the LORD, and through the mercy of the most High he shall not be moved.

name: Psalms 21:8
verse: Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies: thy right hand shall find out those that hate thee.

name: Psalms 21:9
verse: Thou shalt make them as a fiery oven in the time of thine anger: the LORD shall swallow them up in his wrath, and the fire shall devour them.

name: Psalms 21:10
verse: Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from among the children of men.

name: Psalms 21:11
verse: For they intended evil against thee: they imagined a mischievous device, which they are not able to perform.

name: Psalms 21:12
verse: Therefore shalt thou make them turn their back, when thou shalt make ready thine arrows upon thy strings against the face of them.

name: Psalms 21:13
verse: Be thou exalted, LORD, in thine own strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.

name: Psalms 22:1
verse: My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken me? why art thou so far from helping me, and from the words of my roaring?

name: Psalms 22:2
verse: O my God, I cry in the daytime, but thou hearest not; and in the night season, and am not silent.

name: Psalms 22:3
verse: But thou art holy, O thou that inhabitest the praises of Israel.

name: Psalms 22:4
verse: Our fathers trusted in thee: they trusted, and thou didst deliver them.

name: Psalms 22:5
verse: They cried unto thee, and were delivered: they trusted in thee, and were not confounded.

name: Psalms 22:6
verse: But I am a worm, and no man; a reproach of men, and despised of the people.

name: Psalms 22:7
verse: All they that see me laugh me to scorn: they shoot out the lip, they shake the head, saying,

name: Psalms 22:8
verse: He trusted on the LORD that he would deliver him: let him deliver him, seeing he delighted in him.

name: Psalms 22:9
verse: But thou art he that took me out of the womb: thou didst make me hope when I was upon my mother's breasts.

name: Psalms 22:10
verse: I was cast upon thee from the womb: thou art my God from my mother's belly.

name: Psalms 22:11
verse: Be not far from me; for trouble is near; for there is none to help.

name: Psalms 22:12
verse: Many bulls have compassed me: strong bulls of Bashan have beset me round.

name: Psalms 22:13
verse: They gaped upon me with their mouths, as a ravening and a roaring lion.

name: Psalms 22:14
verse: I am poured out like water, and all my bones are out of joint: my heart is like wax; it is melted in the midst of my bowels.

name: Psalms 22:15
verse: My strength is dried up like a potsherd; and my tongue cleaveth to my jaws; and thou hast brought me into the dust of death.

name: Psalms 22:16
verse: For dogs have compassed me: the assembly of the wicked have inclosed me: they pierced my hands and my feet.

name: Psalms 22:17
verse: I may tell all my bones: they look and stare upon me.

name: Psalms 22:18
verse: They part my garments among them, and cast lots upon my vesture.

name: Psalms 22:19
verse: But be not thou far from me, O LORD: O my strength, haste thee to help me.

name: Psalms 22:20
verse: Deliver my soul from the sword; my darling from the power of the dog.

name: Psalms 22:21
verse: Save me from the lion's mouth: for thou hast heard me from the horns of the unicorns.

name: Psalms 22:22
verse: I will declare thy name unto my brethren: in the midst of the congregation will I praise thee.

name: Psalms 22:23
verse: Ye that fear the LORD, praise him; all ye the seed of Jacob, glorify him; and fear him, all ye the seed of Israel.

name: Psalms 22:24
verse: For he hath not despised nor abhorred the affliction of the afflicted; neither hath he hid his face from him; but when he cried unto him, he heard.

name: Psalms 22:25
verse: My praise shall be of thee in the great congregation: I will pay my vows before them that fear him.

name: Psalms 22:26
verse: The meek shall eat and be satisfied: they shall praise the LORD that seek him: your heart shall live for ever.

name: Psalms 22:27
verse: All the ends of the world shall remember and turn unto the LORD: and all the kindreds of the nations shall worship before thee.

name: Psalms 22:28
verse: For the kingdom is the LORD'S: and he is the governor among the nations.

name: Psalms 22:29
verse: All they that be fat upon earth shall eat and worship: all they that go down to the dust shall bow before him: and none can keep alive his own soul.

name: Psalms 22:30
verse: A seed shall serve him; it shall be accounted to the Lord for a generation.

name: Psalms 22:31
verse: They shall come, and shall declare his righteousness unto a people that shall be born, that he hath done this.

name: Psalms 23:1
verse: The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.

name: Psalms 23:2
verse: He maketh me to lie down in green pastures: he leadeth me beside the still waters.

name: Psalms 23:3
verse: He restoreth my soul: he leadeth me in the paths of righteousness for his name's sake.

name: Psalms 23:4
verse: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil: for thou art with me; thy rod and thy staff they comfort me.

name: Psalms 23:5
verse: Thou preparest a table before me in the presence of mine enemies: thou anointest my head with oil; my cup runneth over.

name: Psalms 23:6
verse: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life: and I will dwell in the house of the LORD for ever.

name: Psalms 24:1
verse: The earth is the LORD'S, and the fulness thereof; the world, and they that dwell therein.

name: Psalms 24:2
verse: For he hath founded it upon the seas, and established it upon the floods.

name: Psalms 24:3
verse: Who shall ascend into the hill of the LORD? or who shall stand in his holy place?

name: Psalms 24:4
verse: He that hath clean hands, and a pure heart; who hath not lifted up his soul unto vanity, nor sworn deceitfully.

name: Psalms 24:5
verse: He shall receive the blessing from the LORD, and righteousness from the God of his salvation.

name: Psalms 24:6
verse: This is the generation of them that seek him, that seek thy face, O Jacob. Selah.

name: Psalms 24:7
verse: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

name: Psalms 24:8
verse: Who is this King of glory? The LORD strong and mighty, the LORD mighty in battle.

name: Psalms 24:9
verse: Lift up your heads, O ye gates; even lift them up, ye everlasting doors; and the King of glory shall come in.

name: Psalms 24:10
verse: Who is this King of glory? The LORD of hosts, he is the King of glory. Selah.

name: Psalms 25:1
verse: Unto thee, O LORD, do I lift up my soul.

name: Psalms 25:2
verse: O my God, I trust in thee: let me not be ashamed, let not mine enemies triumph over me.

name: Psalms 25:3
verse: Yea, let none that wait on thee be ashamed: let them be ashamed which transgress without cause.

name: Psalms 25:4
verse: Shew me thy ways, O LORD; teach me thy paths.

name: Psalms 25:5
verse: Lead me in thy truth, and teach me: for thou art the God of my salvation; on thee do I wait all the day.

name: Psalms 25:6
verse: Remember, O LORD, thy tender mercies and thy lovingkindnesses; for they have been ever of old.

name: Psalms 25:7
verse: Remember not the sins of my youth, nor my transgressions: according to thy mercy remember thou me for thy goodness' sake, O LORD.

name: Psalms 25:8
verse: Good and upright is the LORD: therefore will he teach sinners in the way.

name: Psalms 25:9
verse: The meek will he guide in judgment: and the meek will he teach his way.

name: Psalms 25:10
verse: All the paths of the LORD are mercy and truth unto such as keep his covenant and his testimonies.

name: Psalms 25:11
verse: For thy name's sake, O LORD, pardon mine iniquity; for it is great.

name: Psalms 25:12
verse: What man is he that feareth the LORD? him shall he teach in the way that he shall choose.

name: Psalms 25:13
verse: His soul shall dwell at ease; and his seed shall inherit the earth.

name: Psalms 25:14
verse: The secret of the LORD is with them that fear him; and he will shew them his covenant.

name: Psalms 25:15
verse: Mine eyes are ever toward the LORD; for he shall pluck my feet out of the net.

name: Psalms 25:16
verse: Turn thee unto me, and have mercy upon me; for I am desolate and afflicted.

name: Psalms 25:17
verse: The troubles of my heart are enlarged: O bring thou me out of my distresses.

name: Psalms 25:18
verse: Look upon mine affliction and my pain; and forgive all my sins.

name: Psalms 25:19
