verse: The rich and poor meet together: the LORD is the maker of them all.

name: Proverbs 22:3
verse: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself: but the simple pass on, and are punished.

name: Proverbs 22:4
verse: By humility and the fear of the LORD are riches, and honour, and life.

name: Proverbs 22:5
verse: Thorns and snares are in the way of the froward: he that doth keep his soul shall be far from them.

name: Proverbs 22:6
verse: Train up a child in the way he should go: and when he is old, he will not depart from it.

name: Proverbs 22:7
verse: The rich ruleth over the poor, and the borrower is servant to the lender.

name: Proverbs 22:8
verse: He that soweth iniquity shall reap vanity: and the rod of his anger shall fail.

name: Proverbs 22:9
verse: He that hath a bountiful eye shall be blessed; for he giveth of his bread to the poor.

name: Proverbs 22:10
verse: Cast out the scorner, and contention shall go out; yea, strife and reproach shall cease.

name: Proverbs 22:11
verse: He that loveth pureness of heart, for the grace of his lips the king shall be his friend.

name: Proverbs 22:12
verse: The eyes of the LORD preserve knowledge, and he overthroweth the words of the transgressor.

name: Proverbs 22:13
verse: The slothful man saith, There is a lion without, I shall be slain in the streets.

name: Proverbs 22:14
verse: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: he that is abhorred of the LORD shall fall therein.

name: Proverbs 22:15
verse: Foolishness is bound in the heart of a child; but the rod of correction shall drive it far from him.

name: Proverbs 22:16
verse: He that oppresseth the poor to increase his riches, and he that giveth to the rich, shall surely come to want.

name: Proverbs 22:17
verse: Bow down thine ear, and hear the words of the wise, and apply thine heart unto my knowledge.

name: Proverbs 22:18
verse: For it is a pleasant thing if thou keep them within thee; they shall withal be fitted in thy lips.

name: Proverbs 22:19
verse: That thy trust may be in the LORD, I have made known to thee this day, even to thee.

name: Proverbs 22:20
verse: Have not I written to thee excellent things in counsels and knowledge,

name: Proverbs 22:21
verse: That I might make thee know the certainty of the words of truth; that thou mightest answer the words of truth to them that send unto thee?

name: Proverbs 22:22
verse: Rob not the poor, because he is poor: neither oppress the afflicted in the gate:

name: Proverbs 22:23
verse: For the LORD will plead their cause, and spoil the soul of those that spoiled them.

name: Proverbs 22:24
verse: Make no friendship with an angry man; and with a furious man thou shalt not go:

name: Proverbs 22:25
verse: Lest thou learn his ways, and get a snare to thy soul.

name: Proverbs 22:26
verse: Be not thou one of them that strike hands, or of them that are sureties for debts.

name: Proverbs 22:27
verse: If thou hast nothing to pay, why should he take away thy bed from under thee?

name: Proverbs 22:28
verse: Remove not the ancient landmark, which thy fathers have set.

name: Proverbs 22:29
verse: Seest thou a man diligent in his business? he shall stand before kings; he shall not stand before mean men.

name: Proverbs 23:1
verse: When thou sittest to eat with a ruler, consider diligently what is before thee:

name: Proverbs 23:2
verse: And put a knife to thy throat, if thou be a man given to appetite.

name: Proverbs 23:3
verse: Be not desirous of his dainties: for they are deceitful meat.

name: Proverbs 23:4
verse: Labour not to be rich: cease from thine own wisdom.

name: Proverbs 23:5
verse: Wilt thou set thine eyes upon that which is not? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.

name: Proverbs 23:6
verse: Eat thou not the bread of him that hath an evil eye, neither desire thou his dainty meats:

name: Proverbs 23:7
verse: For as he thinketh in his heart, so is he: Eat and drink, saith he to thee; but his heart is not with thee.

name: Proverbs 23:8
verse: The morsel which thou hast eaten shalt thou vomit up, and lose thy sweet words.

name: Proverbs 23:9
verse: Speak not in the ears of a fool: for he will despise the wisdom of thy words.

name: Proverbs 23:10
verse: Remove not the old landmark; and enter not into the fields of the fatherless:

name: Proverbs 23:11
verse: For their redeemer is mighty; he shall plead their cause with thee.

name: Proverbs 23:12
verse: Apply thine heart unto instruction, and thine ears to the words of knowledge.

name: Proverbs 23:13
verse: Withhold not correction from the child: for if thou beatest him with the rod, he shall not die.

name: Proverbs 23:14
verse: Thou shalt beat him with the rod, and shalt deliver his soul from hell.

name: Proverbs 23:15
verse: My son, if thine heart be wise, my heart shall rejoice, even mine.

name: Proverbs 23:16
verse: Yea, my reins shall rejoice, when thy lips speak right things.

name: Proverbs 23:17
verse: Let not thine heart envy sinners: but be thou in the fear of the LORD all the day long.

name: Proverbs 23:18
verse: For surely there is an end; and thine expectation shall not be cut off.

name: Proverbs 23:19
verse: Hear thou, my son, and be wise, and guide thine heart in the way.

name: Proverbs 23:20
verse: Be not among winebibbers; among riotous eaters of flesh:

name: Proverbs 23:21
verse: For the drunkard and the glutton shall come to poverty: and drowsiness shall clothe a man with rags.

name: Proverbs 23:22
verse: Hearken unto thy father that begat thee, and despise not thy mother when she is old.

name: Proverbs 23:23
verse: Buy the truth, and sell it not; also wisdom, and instruction, and understanding.

name: Proverbs 23:24
verse: The father of the righteous shall greatly rejoice: and he that begetteth a wise child shall have joy of him.

name: Proverbs 23:25
verse: Thy father and thy mother shall be glad, and she that bare thee shall rejoice.

name: Proverbs 23:26
verse: My son, give me thine heart, and let thine eyes observe my ways.

name: Proverbs 23:27
verse: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

name: Proverbs 23:28
verse: She also lieth in wait as for a prey, and increaseth the transgressors among men.

name: Proverbs 23:29
verse: Who hath woe? who hath sorrow? who hath contentions? who hath babbling? who hath wounds without cause? who hath redness of eyes?

name: Proverbs 23:30
verse: They that tarry long at the wine; they that go to seek mixed wine.

name: Proverbs 23:31
verse: Look not thou upon the wine when it is red, when it giveth his colour in the cup, when it moveth itself aright.

name: Proverbs 23:32
verse: At the last it biteth like a serpent, and stingeth like an adder.

name: Proverbs 23:33
verse: Thine eyes shall behold strange women, and thine heart shall utter perverse things.

name: Proverbs 23:34
verse: Yea, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst of the sea, or as he that lieth upon the top of a mast.

name: Proverbs 23:35
verse: They have stricken me, shalt thou say, and I was not sick; they have beaten me, and I felt it not: when shall I awake? I will seek it yet again.

name: Proverbs 24:1
verse: Be not thou envious against evil men, neither desire to be with them.

name: Proverbs 24:2
verse: For their heart studieth destruction, and their lips talk of mischief.

name: Proverbs 24:3
verse: Through wisdom is an house builded; and by understanding it is established:

name: Proverbs 24:4
verse: And by knowledge shall the chambers be filled with all precious and pleasant riches.

name: Proverbs 24:5
verse: A wise man is strong; yea, a man of knowledge increaseth strength.

name: Proverbs 24:6
verse: For by wise counsel thou shalt make thy war: and in multitude of counsellors there is safety.

name: Proverbs 24:7
verse: Wisdom is too high for a fool: he openeth not his mouth in the gate.

name: Proverbs 24:8
verse: He that deviseth to do evil shall be called a mischievous person.

name: Proverbs 24:9
verse: The thought of foolishness is sin: and the scorner is an abomination to men.

name: Proverbs 24:10
verse: If thou faint in the day of adversity, thy strength is small.

name: Proverbs 24:11
verse: If thou forbear to deliver them that are drawn unto death, and those that are ready to be slain;

name: Proverbs 24:12
verse: If thou sayest, Behold, we knew it not; doth not he that pondereth the heart consider it? and he that keepeth thy soul, doth not he know it? and shall not he render to every man according to his works?

name: Proverbs 24:13
verse: My son, eat thou honey, because it is good; and the honeycomb, which is sweet to thy taste:

name: Proverbs 24:14
verse: So shall the knowledge of wisdom be unto thy soul: when thou hast found it, then there shall be a reward, and thy expectation shall not be cut off.

name: Proverbs 24:15
verse: Lay not wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; spoil not his resting place:

name: Proverbs 24:16
verse: For a just man falleth seven times, and riseth up again: but the wicked shall fall into mischief.

name: Proverbs 24:17
verse: Rejoice not when thine enemy falleth, and let not thine heart be glad when he stumbleth:

name: Proverbs 24:18
verse: Lest the LORD see it, and it displease him, and he turn away his wrath from him.

name: Proverbs 24:19
verse: Fret not thyself because of evil men, neither be thou envious at the wicked;

name: Proverbs 24:20
verse: For there shall be no reward to the evil man; the candle of the wicked shall be put out.

name: Proverbs 24:21
verse: My son, fear thou the LORD and the king: and meddle not with them that are given to change:

name: Proverbs 24:22
verse: For their calamity shall rise suddenly; and who knoweth the ruin of them both?

name: Proverbs 24:23
verse: These things also belong to the wise. It is not good to have respect of persons in judgment.

name: Proverbs 24:24
verse: He that saith unto the wicked, Thou art righteous; him shall the people curse, nations shall abhor him:

name: Proverbs 24:25
verse: But to them that rebuke him shall be delight, and a good blessing shall come upon them.

name: Proverbs 24:26
verse: Every man shall kiss his lips that giveth a right answer.

name: Proverbs 24:27
verse: Prepare thy work without, and make it fit for thyself in the field; and afterwards build thine house.

name: Proverbs 24:28
verse: Be not a witness against thy neighbour without cause; and deceive not with thy lips.

name: Proverbs 24:29
verse: Say not, I will do so to him as he hath done to me: I will render to the man according to his work.

name: Proverbs 24:30
verse: I went by the field of the slothful, and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;

name: Proverbs 24:31
verse: And, lo, it was all grown over with thorns, and nettles had covered the face thereof, and the stone wall thereof was broken down.

name: Proverbs 24:32
verse: Then I saw, and considered it well: I looked upon it, and received instruction.

name: Proverbs 24:33
verse: Yet a little sleep, a little slumber, a little folding of the hands to sleep:

name: Proverbs 24:34
verse: So shall thy poverty come as one that travelleth; and thy want as an armed man.

name: Proverbs 25:1
verse: These are also proverbs of Solomon, which the men of Hezekiah king of Judah copied out.

name: Proverbs 25:2
verse: It is the glory of God to conceal a thing: but the honour of kings is to search out a matter.

name: Proverbs 25:3
verse: The heaven for height, and the earth for depth, and the heart of kings is unsearchable.

name: Proverbs 25:4
verse: Take away the dross from the silver, and there shall come forth a vessel for the finer.

name: Proverbs 25:5
verse: Take away the wicked from before the king, and his throne shall be established in righteousness.

name: Proverbs 25:6
verse: Put not forth thyself in the presence of the king, and stand not in the place of great men:

name: Proverbs 25:7
verse: For better it is that it be said unto thee, Come up hither; than that thou shouldest be put lower in the presence of the prince whom thine eyes have seen.

name: Proverbs 25:8
verse: Go not forth hastily to strive, lest thou know not what to do in the end thereof, when thy neighbour hath put thee to shame.

name: Proverbs 25:9
verse: Debate thy cause with thy neighbour himself; and discover not a secret to another:

name: Proverbs 25:10
verse: Lest he that heareth it put thee to shame, and thine infamy turn not away.

name: Proverbs 25:11
verse: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.

name: Proverbs 25:12
verse: As an earring of gold, and an ornament of fine gold, so is a wise reprover upon an obedient ear.

name: Proverbs 25:13
verse: As the cold of snow in the time of harvest, so is a faithful messenger to them that send him: for he refresheth the soul of his masters.

name: Proverbs 25:14
verse: Whoso boasteth himself of a false gift is like clouds and wind without rain.

name: Proverbs 25:15
verse: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded, and a soft tongue breaketh the bone.

name: Proverbs 25:16
verse: Hast thou found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for thee, lest thou be filled therewith, and vomit it.

name: Proverbs 25:17
verse: Withdraw thy foot from thy neighbour's house; lest he be weary of thee, and so hate thee.

name: Proverbs 25:18
verse: A man that beareth false witness against his neighbour is a maul, and a sword, and a sharp arrow.

name: Proverbs 25:19
verse: Confidence in an unfaithful man in time of trouble is like a broken tooth, and a foot out of joint.

name: Proverbs 25:20
verse: As he that taketh away a garment in cold weather, and as vinegar upon nitre, so is he that singeth songs to an heavy heart.

name: Proverbs 25:21
verse: If thine enemy be hungry, give him bread to eat; and if he be thirsty, give him water to drink:

name: Proverbs 25:22
verse: For thou shalt heap coals of fire upon his head, and the LORD shall reward thee.

name: Proverbs 25:23
verse: The north wind driveth away rain: so doth an angry countenance a backbiting tongue.

name: Proverbs 25:24
verse: It is better to dwell in the corner of the housetop, than with a brawling woman and in a wide house.

name: Proverbs 25:25
verse: As cold waters to a thirsty soul, so is good news from a far country.

name: Proverbs 25:26
verse: A righteous man falling down before the wicked is as a troubled fountain, and a corrupt spring.

name: Proverbs 25:27
verse: It is not good to eat much honey: so for men to search their own glory is not glory.

name: Proverbs 25:28
verse: He that hath no rule over his own spirit is like a city that is broken down, and without walls.

name: Proverbs 26:1
verse: As snow in summer, and as rain in harvest, so honour is not seemly for a fool.

name: Proverbs 26:2
verse: As the bird by wandering, as the swallow by flying, so the curse causeless shall not come.

name: Proverbs 26:3
verse: A whip for the horse, a bridle for the ass, and a rod for the fool's back.

name: Proverbs 26:4
verse: Answer not a fool according to his folly, lest thou also be like unto him.

name: Proverbs 26:5
verse: Answer a fool according to his folly, lest he be wise in his own conceit.

name: Proverbs 26:6
verse: He that sendeth a message by the hand of a fool cutteth off the feet, and drinketh damage.

name: Proverbs 26:7
verse: The legs of the lame are not equal: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

name: Proverbs 26:8
verse: As he that bindeth a stone in a sling, so is he that giveth honour to a fool.

name: Proverbs 26:9
verse: As a thorn goeth up into the hand of a drunkard, so is a parable in the mouth of fools.

name: Proverbs 26:10
verse: The great God that formed all things both rewardeth the fool, and rewardeth transgressors.

name: Proverbs 26:11
verse: As a dog returneth to his vomit, so a fool returneth to his folly.

name: Proverbs 26:12
verse: Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

name: Proverbs 26:13
verse: The slothful man saith, There is a lion in the way; a lion is in the streets.

name: Proverbs 26:14
verse: As the door turneth upon his hinges, so doth the slothful upon his bed.

name: Proverbs 26:15
verse: The slothful hideth his hand in his bosom; it grieveth him to bring it again to his mouth.

name: Proverbs 26:16
verse: The sluggard is wiser in his own conceit than seven men that can render a reason.

name: Proverbs 26:17
verse: He that passeth by, and meddleth with strife belonging not to him, is like one that taketh a dog by the ears.

name: Proverbs 26:18
verse: As a mad man who casteth firebrands, arrows, and death,

name: Proverbs 26:19
verse: So is the man that deceiveth his neighbour, and saith, Am not I in sport?

name: Proverbs 26:20
verse: Where no wood is, there the fire goeth out: so where there is no talebearer, the strife ceaseth.

name: Proverbs 26:21
verse: As coals are to burning coals, and wood to fire; so is a contentious man to kindle strife.

name: Proverbs 26:22
verse: The words of a talebearer are as wounds, and they go down into the innermost parts of the belly.

name: Proverbs 26:23
verse: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.

name: Proverbs 26:24
verse: He that hateth dissembleth with his lips, and layeth up deceit within him;

name: Proverbs 26:25
verse: When he speaketh fair, believe him not: for there are seven abominations in his heart.

name: Proverbs 26:26
verse: Whose hatred is covered by deceit, his wickedness shall be shewed before the whole congregation.

name: Proverbs 26:27
verse: Whoso diggeth a pit shall fall therein: and he that rolleth a stone, it will return upon him.

name: Proverbs 26:28
verse: A lying tongue hateth those that are afflicted by it; and a flattering mouth worketh ruin.

name: Proverbs 27:1
verse: Boast not thyself of to morrow; for thou knowest not what a day may bring forth.

name: Proverbs 27:2
verse: Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

name: Proverbs 27:3
verse: A stone is heavy, and the sand weighty; but a fool's wrath is heavier than them both.

name: Proverbs 27:4
verse: Wrath is cruel, and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?

name: Proverbs 27:5
verse: Open rebuke is better than secret love.

name: Proverbs 27:6
verse: Faithful are the wounds of a friend; but the kisses of an enemy are deceitful.

name: Proverbs 27:7
verse: The full soul loatheth an honeycomb; but to the hungry soul every bitter thing is sweet.

name: Proverbs 27:8
verse: As a bird that wandereth from her nest, so is a man that wandereth from his place.

name: Proverbs 27:9
verse: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so doth the sweetness of a man's friend by hearty counsel.

name: Proverbs 27:10
verse: Thine own friend, and thy father's friend, forsake not; neither go into thy brother's house in the day of thy calamity: for better is a neighbour that is near than a brother far off.

name: Proverbs 27:11
verse: My son, be wise, and make my heart glad, that I may answer him that reproacheth me.

name: Proverbs 27:12
verse: A prudent man foreseeth the evil, and hideth himself; but the simple pass on, and are punished.

name: Proverbs 27:13
verse: Take his garment that is surety for a stranger, and take a pledge of him for a strange woman.

name: Proverbs 27:14
verse: He that blesseth his friend with a loud voice, rising early in the morning, it shall be counted a curse to him.

name: Proverbs 27:15
verse: A continual dropping in a very rainy day and a contentious woman are alike.

name: Proverbs 27:16
verse: Whosoever hideth her hideth the wind, and the ointment of his right hand, which bewrayeth itself.

name: Proverbs 27:17
verse: Iron sharpeneth iron; so a man sharpeneth the countenance of his friend.

name: Proverbs 27:18
verse: Whoso keepeth the fig tree shall eat the fruit thereof: so he that waiteth on his master shall be honoured.

name: Proverbs 27:19
verse: As in water face answereth to face, so the heart of man to man.

name: Proverbs 27:20
verse: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.

name: Proverbs 27:21
verse: As the fining pot for silver, and the furnace for gold; so is a man to his praise.

name: Proverbs 27:22
verse: Though thou shouldest bray a fool in a mortar among wheat with a pestle, yet will not his foolishness depart from him.

name: Proverbs 27:23
verse: Be thou diligent to know the state of thy flocks, and look well to thy herds.

name: Proverbs 27:24
verse: For riches are not for ever: and doth the crown endure to every generation?

name: Proverbs 27:25
verse: The hay appeareth, and the tender grass sheweth itself, and herbs of the mountains are gathered.

name: Proverbs 27:26
verse: The lambs are for thy clothing, and the goats are the price of the field.

name: Proverbs 27:27
verse: And thou shalt have goats' milk enough for thy food, for the food of thy household, and for the maintenance for thy maidens.

name: Proverbs 28:1
verse: The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.

name: Proverbs 28:2
verse: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.

name: Proverbs 28:3
verse: A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.

name: Proverbs 28:4
verse: They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.

name: Proverbs 28:5
verse: Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all things.

name: Proverbs 28:6
verse: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.

name: Proverbs 28:7
verse: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.

name: Proverbs 28:8
verse: He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.

name: Proverbs 28:9
verse: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.

name: Proverbs 28:10
verse: Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good things in possession.

name: Proverbs 28:11
verse: The rich man is wise in his own conceit; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.

name: Proverbs 28:12
verse: When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.

name: Proverbs 28:13
verse: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.

name: Proverbs 28:14
verse: Happy is the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.

name: Proverbs 28:15
verse: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.

name: Proverbs 28:16
verse: The prince that wanteth understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.

name: Proverbs 28:17
verse: A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.

name: Proverbs 28:18
verse: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.

name: Proverbs 28:19
verse: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.

name: Proverbs 28:20
verse: A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

name: Proverbs 28:21
verse: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.

name: Proverbs 28:22
verse: He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.

name: Proverbs 28:23
verse: He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.

name: Proverbs 28:24
verse: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.

name: Proverbs 28:25
verse: He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.

name: Proverbs 28:26
verse: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.

name: Proverbs 28:27
verse: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.

name: Proverbs 28:28
verse: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.

name: Proverbs 29:1
verse: He, that being often reproved hardeneth his neck, shall suddenly be destroyed, and that without remedy.

name: Proverbs 29:2
verse: When the righteous are in authority, the people rejoice: but when the wicked beareth rule, the people mourn.

name: Proverbs 29:3
verse: Whoso loveth wisdom rejoiceth his father: but he that keepeth company with harlots spendeth his substance.

name: Proverbs 29:4
verse: The king by judgment establisheth the land: but he that receiveth gifts overthroweth it.

name: Proverbs 29:5
verse: A man that flattereth his neighbour spreadeth a net for his feet.

name: Proverbs 29:6
verse: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous doth sing and rejoice.

name: Proverbs 29:7
verse: The righteous considereth the cause of the poor: but the wicked regardeth not to know it.

name: Proverbs 29:8
verse: Scornful men bring a city into a snare: but wise men turn away wrath.

name: Proverbs 29:9
verse: If a wise man contendeth with a foolish man, whether he rage or laugh, there is no rest.

name: Proverbs 29:10
verse: The bloodthirsty hate the upright: but the just seek his soul.

name: Proverbs 29:11
verse: A fool uttereth all his mind: but a wise man keepeth it in till afterwards.

name: Proverbs 29:12
verse: If a ruler hearken to lies, all his servants are wicked.

name: Proverbs 29:13
verse: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the LORD lighteneth both their eyes.

name: Proverbs 29:14
verse: The king that faithfully judgeth the poor, his throne shall be established for ever.

name: Proverbs 29:15
verse: The rod and reproof give wisdom: but a child left to himself bringeth his mother to shame.

name: Proverbs 29:16
verse: When the wicked are multiplied, transgression increaseth: but the righteous shall see their fall.

name: Proverbs 29:17
verse: Correct thy son, and he shall give thee rest; yea, he shall give delight unto thy soul.

name: Proverbs 29:18
verse: Where there is no vision, the people perish: but he that keepeth the law, happy is he.

name: Proverbs 29:19
verse: A servant will not be corrected by words: for though he understand he will not answer.

name: Proverbs 29:20
verse: Seest thou a man that is hasty in his words? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

name: Proverbs 29:21
verse: He that delicately bringeth up his servant from a child shall have him become his son at the length.

name: Proverbs 29:22
verse: An angry man stirreth up strife, and a furious man aboundeth in transgression.

name: Proverbs 29:23
verse: A man's pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.

name: Proverbs 29:24
verse: Whoso is partner with a thief hateth his own soul: he heareth cursing, and bewrayeth it not.

name: Proverbs 29:25
verse: The fear of man bringeth a snare: but whoso putteth his trust in the LORD shall be safe.

name: Proverbs 29:26
verse: Many seek the ruler's favour; but every man's judgment cometh from the LORD.

name: Proverbs 29:27
verse: An unjust man is an abomination to the just: and he that is upright in the way is abomination to the wicked.

name: Proverbs 30:1
verse: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,

name: Proverbs 30:2
verse: Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.

name: Proverbs 30:3
verse: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.

name: Proverbs 30:4
verse: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what is his name, and what is his son's name, if thou canst tell?

name: Proverbs 30:5
verse: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.

name: Proverbs 30:6
verse: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.

name: Proverbs 30:7
verse: Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die:

name: Proverbs 30:8
verse: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:

name: Proverbs 30:9
verse: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God in vain.

name: Proverbs 30:10
verse: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.

name: Proverbs 30:11
verse: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.

name: Proverbs 30:12
verse: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.

name: Proverbs 30:13
verse: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.

name: Proverbs 30:14
verse: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.

name: Proverbs 30:15
verse: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:

name: Proverbs 30:16
verse: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.

name: Proverbs 30:17
verse: The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.

name: Proverbs 30:18
verse: There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:

name: Proverbs 30:19
verse: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.

name: Proverbs 30:20
verse: Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.

name: Proverbs 30:21
verse: For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:

name: Proverbs 30:22
verse: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;

name: Proverbs 30:23
verse: For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.

name: Proverbs 30:24
verse: There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:

name: Proverbs 30:25
verse: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;

name: Proverbs 30:26
verse: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;

name: Proverbs 30:27
verse: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;

name: Proverbs 30:28
verse: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings' palaces.

name: Proverbs 30:29
verse: There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:

name: Proverbs 30:30
verse: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;

name: Proverbs 30:31
verse: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.

name: Proverbs 30:32
verse: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.

name: Proverbs 30:33
verse: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.

name: Proverbs 31:1
verse: The words of king Lemuel, the prophecy that his mother taught him.

name: Proverbs 31:2
verse: What, my son? and what, the son of my womb? and what, the son of my vows?

name: Proverbs 31:3
verse: Give not thy strength unto women, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth kings.

name: Proverbs 31:4
verse: It is not for kings, O Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:

name: Proverbs 31:5
verse: Lest they drink, and forget the law, and pervert the judgment of any of the afflicted.

name: Proverbs 31:6
verse: Give strong drink unto him that is ready to perish, and wine unto those that be of heavy hearts.

name: Proverbs 31:7
verse: Let him drink, and forget his poverty, and remember his misery no more.

name: Proverbs 31:8
verse: Open thy mouth for the dumb in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction.

name: Proverbs 31:9
verse: Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.

name: Proverbs 31:10
verse: Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.

name: Proverbs 31:11
verse: The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of spoil.

name: Proverbs 31:12
verse: She will do him good and not evil all the days of her life.

name: Proverbs 31:13
verse: She seeketh wool, and flax, and worketh willingly with her hands.

name: Proverbs 31:14
verse: She is like the merchants' ships; she bringeth her food from afar.

name: Proverbs 31:15
verse: She riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth meat to her household, and a portion to her maidens.

name: Proverbs 31:16
verse: She considereth a field, and buyeth it: with the fruit of her hands she planteth a vineyard.

name: Proverbs 31:17
verse: She girdeth her loins with strength, and strengtheneth her arms.

name: Proverbs 31:18
verse: She perceiveth that her merchandise is good: her candle goeth not out by night.

name: Proverbs 31:19
verse: She layeth her hands to the spindle, and her hands hold the distaff.

name: Proverbs 31:20
verse: She stretcheth out her hand to the poor; yea, she reacheth forth her hands to the needy.

name: Proverbs 31:21
verse: She is not afraid of the snow for her household: for all her household are clothed with scarlet.

name: Proverbs 31:22
verse: She maketh herself coverings of tapestry; her clothing is silk and purple.

name: Proverbs 31:23
verse: Her husband is known in the gates, when he sitteth among the elders of the land.

name: Proverbs 31:24
verse: She maketh fine linen, and selleth it; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant.

name: Proverbs 31:25
verse: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.

name: Proverbs 31:26
verse: She openeth her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.

name: Proverbs 31:27
verse: She looketh well to the ways of her household, and eateth not the bread of idleness.

name: Proverbs 31:28
verse: Her children arise up, and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praiseth her.

name: Proverbs 31:29
verse: Many daughters have done virtuously, but thou excellest them all.

name: Proverbs 31:30
verse: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.

name: Proverbs 31:31
verse: Give her of the fruit of her hands; and let her own works praise her in the gates.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:1
verse: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:2
verse: Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:3
verse: What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?

name: Ecclesiastes 1:4
verse: One generation passeth away, and another generation cometh: but the earth abideth for ever.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:5
verse: The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:6
verse: The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returneth again according to his circuits.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:7
verse: All the rivers run into the sea; yet the sea is not full; unto the place from whence the rivers come, thither they return again.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:8
verse: All things are full of labour; man cannot utter it: the eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:9
verse: The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done is that which shall be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:10
verse: Is there any thing whereof it may be said, See, this is new? it hath been already of old time, which was before us.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:11
verse: There is no remembrance of former things; neither shall there be any remembrance of things that are to come with those that shall come after.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:12
verse: I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:13
verse: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:14
verse: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all is vanity and vexation of spirit.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:15
verse: That which is crooked cannot be made straight: and that which is wanting cannot be numbered.

name: Ecclesiastes 1:16
verse: I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yea, my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.

name: Jude 1:12
verse: These are spots in your feasts of charity, when they feast with you, feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water, carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withereth, without fruit, twice dead, plucked up by the roots;

name: Jude 1:13
verse: Raging waves of the sea, foaming out their own shame; wandering stars, to whom is reserved the blackness of darkness for ever.

name: Jude 1:14
verse: And Enoch also, the seventh from Adam, prophesied of these, saying, Behold, the Lord cometh with ten thousands of his saints,

name: Jude 1:15
verse: To execute judgment upon all, and to convince all that are ungodly among them of all their ungodly deeds which they have ungodly committed, and of all their hard speeches which ungodly sinners have spoken against him.

name: Jude 1:16
verse: These are murmurers, complainers, walking after their own lusts; and their mouth speaketh great swelling words, having men's persons in admiration because of advantage.

name: Jude 1:17
verse: But, beloved, remember ye the words which were spoken before of the apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ;

name: Jude 1:18
verse: How that they told you there should be mockers in the last time, who should walk after their own ungodly lusts.

name: Jude 1:19
verse: These be they who separate themselves, sensual, having not the Spirit.

name: Jude 1:20
verse: But ye, beloved, building up yourselves on your most holy faith, praying in the Holy Ghost,

name: Jude 1:21
verse: Keep yourselves in the love of God, looking for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ unto eternal life.

name: Jude 1:22
verse: And of some have compassion, making a difference:

name: Jude 1:23
verse: And others save with fear, pulling them out of the fire; hating even the garment spotted by the flesh.

name: Jude 1:24
verse: Now unto him that is able to keep you from falling, and to present you faultless before the presence of his glory with exceeding joy,

name: Jude 1:25
verse: To the only wise God our Saviour, be glory and majesty, dominion and power, both now and ever. Amen.

name: Revelation 1:1
verse: The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave unto him, to shew unto his servants things which must shortly come to pass; and he sent and signified it by his angel unto his servant John:

name: Revelation 1:2
verse: Who bare record of the word of God, and of the testimony of Jesus Christ, and of all things that he saw.

name: Revelation 1:3
verse: Blessed is he that readeth, and they that hear the words of this prophecy, and keep those things which are written therein: for the time is at hand.

name: Revelation 1:4
verse: John to the seven churches which are in Asia: Grace be unto you, and peace, from him which is, and which was, and which is to come; and from the seven Spirits which are before his throne;

name: Revelation 1:5
verse: And from Jesus Christ, who is the faithful witness, and the first begotten of the dead, and the prince of the kings of the earth. Unto him that loved us, and washed us from our sins in his own blood,

name: Revelation 1:6
verse: And hath made us kings and priests unto God and his Father; to him be glory and dominion for ever and ever. Amen.

name: Revelation 1:7
verse: Behold, he cometh with clouds; and every eye shall see him, and they also which pierced him: and all kindreds of the earth shall wail because of him. Even so, Amen.

name: Revelation 1:8
verse: I am Alpha and Omega, the beginning and the ending, saith the Lord, which is, and which was, and which is to come, the Almighty.

name: Revelation 1:9
verse: I John, who also am your brother, and companion in tribulation, and in the kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was in the isle that is called Patmos, for the word of God, and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.

name: Revelation 1:10
verse: I was in the Spirit on the Lord's day, and heard behind me a great voice, as of a trumpet,

name: Revelation 1:11
verse: Saying, I am Alpha and Omega, the first and the last: and, What thou seest, write in a book, and send it unto the seven churches which are in Asia; unto Ephesus, and unto Smyrna, and unto Pergamos, and unto Thyatira, and unto Sardis, and unto Philadelphia, and unto Laodicea.

name: Revelation 1:12
verse: And I turned to see the voice that spake with me. And being turned, I saw seven golden candlesticks;

name: Revelation 1:13
verse: And in the midst of the seven candlesticks one like unto the Son of man, clothed with a garment down to the foot, and girt about the paps with a golden girdle.

name: Revelation 1:14
verse: His head and his hairs were white like wool, as white as snow; and his eyes were as a flame of fire;

name: Revelation 1:15
verse: And his feet like unto fine brass, as if they burned in a furnace; and his voice as the sound of many waters.

name: Revelation 1:16
verse: And he had in his right hand seven stars: and out of his mouth went a sharp twoedged sword: and his countenance was as the sun shineth in his strength.

name: Revelation 1:17
verse: And when I saw him, I fell at his feet as dead. And he laid his right hand upon me, saying unto me, Fear not; I am the first and the last:

name: Revelation 1:18
verse: I am he that liveth, and was dead; and, behold, I am alive for evermore, Amen; and have the keys of hell and of death.

name: Revelation 1:19
verse: Write the things which thou hast seen, and the things which are, and the things which shall be hereafter;

name: Revelation 1:20
verse: The mystery of the seven stars which thou sawest in my right hand, and the seven golden candlesticks. The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches: and the seven candlesticks which thou sawest are the seven churches.

name: Revelation 2:1
verse: Unto the angel of the church of Ephesus write; These things saith he that holdeth the seven stars in his right hand, who walketh in the midst of the seven golden candlesticks;

name: Revelation 2:2
verse: I know thy works, and thy labour, and thy patience, and how thou canst not bear them which are evil: and thou hast tried them which say they are apostles, and are not, and hast found them liars:

name: Revelation 2:3
verse: And hast borne, and hast patience, and for my name's sake hast laboured, and hast not fainted.

name: Revelation 2:4
verse: Nevertheless I have somewhat against thee, because thou hast left thy first love.

name: Revelation 2:5
verse: Remember therefore from whence thou art fallen, and repent, and do the first works; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will remove thy candlestick out of his place, except thou repent.

name: Revelation 2:6
verse: But this thou hast, that thou hatest the deeds of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.

name: Revelation 2:7
verse: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the tree of life, which is in the midst of the paradise of God.

name: Revelation 2:8
verse: And unto the angel of the church in Smyrna write; These things saith the first and the last, which was dead, and is alive;

name: Revelation 2:9
verse: I know thy works, and tribulation, and poverty, (but thou art rich) and I know the blasphemy of them which say they are Jews, and are not, but are the synagogue of Satan.

name: Revelation 2:10
verse: Fear none of those things which thou shalt suffer: behold, the devil shall cast some of you into prison, that ye may be tried; and ye shall have tribulation ten days: be thou faithful unto death, and I will give thee a crown of life.

name: Revelation 2:11
verse: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; He that overcometh shall not be hurt of the second death.

name: Revelation 2:12
verse: And to the angel of the church in Pergamos write; These things saith he which hath the sharp sword with two edges;

name: Revelation 2:13
verse: I know thy works, and where thou dwellest, even where Satan's seat is: and thou holdest fast my name, and hast not denied my faith, even in those days wherein Antipas was my faithful martyr, who was slain among you, where Satan dwelleth.

name: Revelation 2:14
verse: But I have a few things against thee, because thou hast there them that hold the doctrine of Balaam, who taught Balac to cast a stumblingblock before the children of Israel, to eat things sacrificed unto idols, and to commit fornication.

name: Revelation 2:15
verse: So hast thou also them that hold the doctrine of the Nicolaitans, which thing I hate.

name: Revelation 2:16
verse: Repent; or else I will come unto thee quickly, and will fight against them with the sword of my mouth.

name: Revelation 2:17
verse: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches; To him that overcometh will I give to eat of the hidden manna, and will give him a white stone, and in the stone a new name written, which no man knoweth saving he that receiveth it.

name: Revelation 2:18
verse: And unto the angel of the church in Thyatira write; These things saith the Son of God, who hath his eyes like unto a flame of fire, and his feet are like fine brass;

name: Revelation 2:19
verse: I know thy works, and charity, and service, and faith, and thy patience, and thy works; and the last to be more than the first.

name: Revelation 2:20
verse: Notwithstanding I have a few things against thee, because thou sufferest that woman Jezebel, which calleth herself a prophetess, to teach and to seduce my servants to commit fornication, and to eat things sacrificed unto idols.

name: Revelation 2:21
verse: And I gave her space to repent of her fornication; and she repented not.

name: Revelation 2:22
verse: Behold, I will cast her into a bed, and them that commit adultery with her into great tribulation, except they repent of their deeds.

name: Revelation 2:23
verse: And I will kill her children with death; and all the churches shall know that I am he which searcheth the reins and hearts: and I will give unto every one of you according to your works.

name: Revelation 2:24
verse: But unto you I say, and unto the rest in Thyatira, as many as have not this doctrine, and which have not known the depths of Satan, as they speak; I will put upon you none other burden.

name: Revelation 2:25
verse: But that which ye have already hold fast till I come.

name: Revelation 2:26
verse: And he that overcometh, and keepeth my works unto the end, to him will I give power over the nations:

name: Revelation 2:27
verse: And he shall rule them with a rod of iron; as the vessels of a potter shall they be broken to shivers: even as I received of my Father.

name: Revelation 2:28
verse: And I will give him the morning star.

name: Revelation 2:29
verse: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

name: Revelation 3:1
verse: And unto the angel of the church in Sardis write; These things saith he that hath the seven Spirits of God, and the seven stars; I know thy works, that thou hast a name that thou livest, and art dead.

name: Revelation 3:2
verse: Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die: for I have not found thy works perfect before God.

name: Revelation 3:3
verse: Remember therefore how thou hast received and heard, and hold fast, and repent. If therefore thou shalt not watch, I will come on thee as a thief, and thou shalt not know what hour I will come upon thee.

name: Revelation 3:4
verse: Thou hast a few names even in Sardis which have not defiled their garments; and they shall walk with me in white: for they are worthy.

name: Revelation 3:5
verse: He that overcometh, the same shall be clothed in white raiment; and I will not blot out his name out of the book of life, but I will confess his name before my Father, and before his angels.

name: Revelation 3:6
verse: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

name: Revelation 3:7
verse: And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write; These things saith he that is holy, he that is true, he that hath the key of David, he that openeth, and no man shutteth; and shutteth, and no man openeth;

name: Revelation 3:8
verse: I know thy works: behold, I have set before thee an open door, and no man can shut it: for thou hast a little strength, and hast kept my word, and hast not denied my name.

name: Revelation 3:9
verse: Behold, I will make them of the synagogue of Satan, which say they are Jews, and are not, but do lie; behold, I will make them to come and worship before thy feet, and to know that I have loved thee.

name: Revelation 3:10
verse: Because thou hast kept the word of my patience, I also will keep thee from the hour of temptation, which shall come upon all the world, to try them that dwell upon the earth.

name: Revelation 3:11
verse: Behold, I come quickly: hold that fast which thou hast, that no man take thy crown.

name: Revelation 3:12
verse: Him that overcometh will I make a pillar in the temple of my God, and he shall go no more out: and I will write upon him the name of my God, and the name of the city of my God, which is new Jerusalem, which cometh down out of heaven from my God: and I will write upon him my new name.

name: Revelation 3:13
verse: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

name: Revelation 3:14
verse: And unto the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write; These things saith the Amen, the faithful and true witness, the beginning of the creation of God;

name: Revelation 3:15
verse: I know thy works, that thou art neither cold nor hot: I would thou wert cold or hot.

name: Revelation 3:16
verse: So then because thou art lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will spue thee out of my mouth.

name: Revelation 3:17
verse: Because thou sayest, I am rich, and increased with goods, and have need of nothing; and knowest not that thou art wretched, and miserable, and poor, and blind, and naked:

name: Revelation 3:18
verse: I counsel thee to buy of me gold tried in the fire, that thou mayest be rich; and white raiment, that thou mayest be clothed, and that the shame of thy nakedness do not appear; and anoint thine eyes with eyesalve, that thou mayest see.

name: Revelation 3:19
verse: As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten: be zealous therefore, and repent.

name: Revelation 3:20
verse: Behold, I stand at the door, and knock: if any man hear my voice, and open the door, I will come in to him, and will sup with him, and he with me.

name: Revelation 3:21
verse: To him that overcometh will I grant to sit with me in my throne, even as I also overcame, and am set down with my Father in his throne.

name: Revelation 3:22
verse: He that hath an ear, let him hear what the Spirit saith unto the churches.

name: Revelation 4:1
verse: After this I looked, and, behold, a door was opened in heaven: and the first voice which I heard was as it were of a trumpet talking with me; which said, Come up hither, and I will shew thee things which must be hereafter.

name: Revelation 4:2
verse: And immediately I was in the spirit: and, behold, a throne was set in heaven, and one sat on the throne.

name: Revelation 4:3
verse: And he that sat was to look upon like a jasper and a sardine stone: and there was a rainbow round about the throne, in sight like unto an emerald.

name: Revelation 4:4
verse: And round about the throne were four and twenty seats: and upon the seats I saw four and twenty elders sitting, clothed in white raiment; and they had on their heads crowns of gold.

name: Revelation 4:5
verse: And out of the throne proceeded lightnings and thunderings and voices: and there were seven lamps of fire burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.

name: Revelation 4:6
verse: And before the throne there was a sea of glass like unto crystal: and in the midst of the throne, and round about the throne, were four beasts full of eyes before and behind.

name: Revelation 4:7
verse: And the first beast was like a lion, and the second beast like a calf, and the third beast had a face as a man, and the fourth beast was like a flying eagle.

name: Revelation 4:8
verse: And the four beasts had each of them six wings about him; and they were full of eyes within: and they rest not day and night, saying, Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty, which was, and is, and is to come.

name: Revelation 4:9
verse: And when those beasts give glory and honour and thanks to him that sat on the throne, who liveth for ever and ever,

name: Revelation 4:10
verse: The four and twenty elders fall down before him that sat on the throne, and worship him that liveth for ever and ever, and cast their crowns before the throne, saying,

name: Revelation 4:11
verse: Thou art worthy, O Lord, to receive glory and honour and power: for thou hast created all things, and for thy pleasure they are and were created.

name: Revelation 5:1
verse: And I saw in the right hand of him that sat on the throne a book written within and on the backside, sealed with seven seals.

name: Revelation 5:2
verse: And I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, Who is worthy to open the book, and to loose the seals thereof?

name: Revelation 5:3
verse: And no man in heaven, nor in earth, neither under the earth, was able to open the book, neither to look thereon.

name: Revelation 5:4
verse: And I wept much, because no man was found worthy to open and to read the book, neither to look thereon.

name: Revelation 5:5
verse: And one of the elders saith unto me, Weep not: behold, the Lion of the tribe of Juda, the Root of David, hath prevailed to open the book, and to loose the seven seals thereof.

name: Revelation 5:6
verse: And I beheld, and, lo, in the midst of the throne and of the four beasts, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb as it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent forth into all the earth.

name: Revelation 5:7
verse: And he came and took the book out of the right hand of him that sat upon the throne.

name: Revelation 5:8
verse: And when he had taken the book, the four beasts and four and twenty elders fell down before the Lamb, having every one of them harps, and golden vials full of odours, which are the prayers of saints.

name: Revelation 5:9
verse: And they sung a new song, saying, Thou art worthy to take the book, and to open the seals thereof: for thou wast slain, and hast redeemed us to God by thy blood out of every kindred, and tongue, and people, and nation;

name: Revelation 5:10
verse: And hast made us unto our God kings and priests: and we shall reign on the earth.

name: Revelation 5:11
verse: And I beheld, and I heard the voice of many angels round about the throne and the beasts and the elders: and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands;

name: Revelation 5:12
verse: Saying with a loud voice, Worthy is the Lamb that was slain to receive power, and riches, and wisdom, and strength, and honour, and glory, and blessing.

name: Revelation 5:13
verse: And every creature which is in heaven, and on the earth, and under the earth, and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, heard I saying, Blessing, and honour, and glory, and power, be unto him that sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb for ever and ever.

name: Revelation 5:14
verse: And the four beasts said, Amen. And the four and twenty elders fell down and worshipped him that liveth for ever and ever.

name: Revelation 6:1
verse: And I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals, and I heard, as it were the noise of thunder, one of the four beasts saying, Come and see.

name: Revelation 6:2
verse: And I saw, and behold a white horse: and he that sat on him had a bow; and a crown was given unto him: and he went forth conquering, and to conquer.

name: Revelation 6:3
verse: And when he had opened the second seal, I heard the second beast say, Come and see.

name: Revelation 6:4
verse: And there went out another horse that was red: and power was given to him that sat thereon to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another: and there was given unto him a great sword.

name: Revelation 6:5
verse: And when he had opened the third seal, I heard the third beast say, Come and see. And I beheld, and lo a black horse; and he that sat on him had a pair of balances in his hand.

name: Revelation 6:6
verse: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four beasts say, A measure of wheat for a penny, and three measures of barley for a penny; and see thou hurt not the oil and the wine.

name: Revelation 6:7
verse: And when he had opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth beast say, Come and see.

name: Revelation 6:8
verse: And I looked, and behold a pale horse: and his name that sat on him was Death, and Hell followed with him. And power was given unto them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with sword, and with hunger, and with death, and with the beasts of the earth.

name: Revelation 6:9
verse: And when he had opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of them that were slain for the word of God, and for the testimony which they held:

name: Revelation 6:10
verse: And they cried with a loud voice, saying, How long, O Lord, holy and true, dost thou not judge and avenge our blood on them that dwell on the earth?

name: Revelation 6:11
verse: And white robes were given unto every one of them; and it was said unto them, that they should rest yet for a little season, until their fellowservants also and their brethren, that should be killed as they were, should be fulfilled.

name: Revelation 6:12
verse: And I beheld when he had opened the sixth seal, and, lo, there was a great earthquake; and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and the moon became as blood;

name: Revelation 6:13
verse: And the stars of heaven fell unto the earth, even as a fig tree casteth her untimely figs, when she is shaken of a mighty wind.

name: Revelation 6:14
verse: And the heaven departed as a scroll when it is rolled together; and every mountain and island were moved out of their places.

name: Revelation 6:15
verse: And the kings of the earth, and the great men, and the rich men, and the chief captains, and the mighty men, and every bondman, and every free man, hid themselves in the dens and in the rocks of the mountains;

name: Revelation 6:16
verse: And said to the mountains and rocks, Fall on us, and hide us from the face of him that sitteth on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb:

name: Revelation 6:17
verse: For the great day of his wrath is come; and who shall be able to stand?

name: Revelation 7:1
verse: And after these things I saw four angels standing on the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that the wind should not blow on the earth, nor on the sea, nor on any tree.

name: Revelation 7:2
verse: And I saw another angel ascending from the east, having the seal of the living God: and he cried with a loud voice to the four angels, to whom it was given to hurt the earth and the sea,

name: Revelation 7:3
verse: Saying, Hurt not the earth, neither the sea, nor the trees, till we have sealed the servants of our God in their foreheads.

name: Revelation 7:4
verse: And I heard the number of them which were sealed: and there were sealed an hundred and forty and four thousand of all the tribes of the children of Israel.

name: Revelation 7:5
verse: Of the tribe of Juda were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Reuben were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Gad were sealed twelve thousand.

name: Revelation 7:6
verse: Of the tribe of Aser were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Nepthalim were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Manasses were sealed twelve thousand.

name: Revelation 7:7
verse: Of the tribe of Simeon were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Levi were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Issachar were sealed twelve thousand.

name: Revelation 7:8
verse: Of the tribe of Zabulon were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Joseph were sealed twelve thousand. Of the tribe of Benjamin were sealed twelve thousand.

name: Revelation 7:9
verse: After this I beheld, and, lo, a great multitude, which no man could number, of all nations, and kindreds, and people, and tongues, stood before the throne, and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, and palms in their hands;

name: Revelation 7:10
verse: And cried with a loud voice, saying, Salvation to our God which sitteth upon the throne, and unto the Lamb.

name: Revelation 7:11
verse: And all the angels stood round about the throne, and about the elders and the four beasts, and fell before the throne on their faces, and worshipped God,

name: Revelation 7:12
verse: Saying, Amen: Blessing, and glory, and wisdom, and thanksgiving, and honour, and power, and might, be unto our God for ever and ever. Amen.

name: Revelation 7:13
verse: And one of the elders answered, saying unto me, What are these which are arrayed in white robes? and whence came they?

name: Revelation 7:14
verse: And I said unto him, Sir, thou knowest. And he said to me, These are they which came out of great tribulation, and have washed their robes, and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.

name: Revelation 7:15
verse: Therefore are they before the throne of God, and serve him day and night in his temple: and he that sitteth on the throne shall dwell among them.

name: Revelation 7:16
verse: They shall hunger no more, neither thirst any more; neither shall the sun light on them, nor any heat.

name: Revelation 7:17
verse: For the Lamb which is in the midst of the throne shall feed them, and shall lead them unto living fountains of waters: and God shall wipe away all tears from their eyes.

name: Revelation 8:1
verse: And when he had opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven about the space of half an hour.

name: Revelation 8:2
verse: And I saw the seven angels which stood before God; and to them were given seven trumpets.

name: Revelation 8:3
verse: And another angel came and stood at the altar, having a golden censer; and there was given unto him much incense, that he should offer it with the prayers of all saints upon the golden altar which was before the throne.

name: Revelation 8:4
verse: And the smoke of the incense, which came with the prayers of the saints, ascended up before God out of the angel's hand.

name: Revelation 8:5
verse: And the angel took the censer, and filled it with fire of the altar, and cast it into the earth: and there were voices, and thunderings, and lightnings, and an earthquake.

name: Revelation 8:6
verse: And the seven angels which had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.

name: Revelation 8:7
verse: The first angel sounded, and there followed hail and fire mingled with blood, and they were cast upon the earth: and the third part of trees was burnt up, and all green grass was burnt up.

name: Revelation 8:8
verse: And the second angel sounded, and as it were a great mountain burning with fire was cast into the sea: and the third part of the sea became blood;

name: Revelation 8:9
verse: And the third part of the creatures which were in the sea, and had life, died; and the third part of the ships were destroyed.

name: Revelation 8:10
verse: And the third angel sounded, and there fell a great star from heaven, burning as it were a lamp, and it fell upon the third part of the rivers, and upon the fountains of waters;

name: Revelation 8:11
verse: And the name of the star is called Wormwood: and the third part of the waters became wormwood; and many men died of the waters, because they were made bitter.

name: Revelation 8:12
verse: And the fourth angel sounded, and the third part of the sun was smitten, and the third part of the moon, and the third part of the stars; so as the third part of them was darkened, and the day shone not for a third part of it, and the night likewise.

name: Revelation 8:13
verse: And I beheld, and heard an angel flying through the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice, Woe, woe, woe, to the inhabiters of the earth by reason of the other voices of the trumpet of the three angels, which are yet to sound!

name: Revelation 9:1
verse: And the fifth angel sounded, and I saw a star fall from heaven unto the earth: and to him was given the key of the bottomless pit.

name: Revelation 9:2
verse: And he opened the bottomless pit; and there arose a smoke out of the pit, as the smoke of a great furnace; and the sun and the air were darkened by reason of the smoke of the pit.

name: Revelation 9:3
verse: And there came out of the smoke locusts upon the earth: and unto them was given power, as the scorpions of the earth have power.

name: Revelation 9:4
verse: And it was commanded them that they should not hurt the grass of the earth, neither any green thing, neither any tree; but only those men which have not the seal of God in their foreheads.

name: Revelation 9:5
verse: And to them it was given that they should not kill them, but that they should be tormented five months: and their torment was as the torment of a scorpion, when he striketh a man.

name: Revelation 9:6
verse: And in those days shall men seek death, and shall not find it; and shall desire to die, and death shall flee from them.

name: Revelation 9:7
verse: And the shapes of the locusts were like unto horses prepared unto battle; and on their heads were as it were crowns like gold, and their faces were as the faces of men.

name: Revelation 9:8
verse: And they had hair as the hair of women, and their teeth were as the teeth of lions.

name: Revelation 9:9
verse: And they had breastplates, as it were breastplates of iron; and the sound of their wings was as the sound of chariots of many horses running to battle.

name: Revelation 9:10
verse: And they had tails like unto scorpions, and there were stings in their tails: and their power was to hurt men five months.

name: Revelation 9:11
verse: And they had a king over them, which is the angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in the Hebrew tongue is Abaddon, but in the Greek tongue hath his name Apollyon.

name: Revelation 9:12
verse: One woe is past; and, behold, there come two woes more hereafter.

name: Revelation 9:13
verse: And the sixth angel sounded, and I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God,

name: Revelation 9:14
verse: Saying to the sixth angel which had the trumpet, Loose the four angels which are bound in the great river Euphrates.

name: Revelation 9:15
verse: And the four angels were loosed, which were prepared for an hour, and a day, and a month, and a year, for to slay the third part of men.

name: Revelation 9:16
verse: And the number of the army of the horsemen were two hundred thousand thousand: and I heard the number of them.

name: Revelation 9:17
verse: And thus I saw the horses in the vision, and them that sat on them, having breastplates of fire, and of jacinth, and brimstone: and the heads of the horses were as the heads of lions; and out of their mouths issued fire and smoke and brimstone.

name: Revelation 9:18
verse: By these three was the third part of men killed, by the fire, and by the smoke, and by the brimstone, which issued out of their mouths.

name: Revelation 9:19
verse: For their power is in their mouth, and in their tails: for their tails were like unto serpents, and had heads, and with them they do hurt.

name: Revelation 9:20
verse: And the rest of the men which were not killed by these plagues yet repented not of the works of their hands, that they should not worship devils, and idols of gold, and silver, and brass, and stone, and of wood: which neither can see, nor hear, nor walk:

name: Revelation 9:21
verse: Neither repented they of their murders, nor of their sorceries, nor of their fornication, nor of their thefts.

name: Revelation 10:1
verse: And I saw another mighty angel come down from heaven, clothed with a cloud: and a rainbow was upon his head, and his face was as it were the sun, and his feet as pillars of fire:

name: Revelation 10:2
verse: And he had in his hand a little book open: and he set his right foot upon the sea, and his left foot on the earth,

name: Revelation 10:3
verse: And cried with a loud voice, as when a lion roareth: and when he had cried, seven thunders uttered their voices.

name: Revelation 10:4
verse: And when the seven thunders had uttered their voices, I was about to write: and I heard a voice from heaven saying unto me, Seal up those things which the seven thunders uttered, and write them not.

name: Revelation 10:5
verse: And the angel which I saw stand upon the sea and upon the earth lifted up his hand to heaven,

name: Revelation 10:6
verse: And sware by him that liveth for ever and ever, who created heaven, and the things that therein are, and the earth, and the things that therein are, and the sea, and the things which are therein, that there should be time no longer:

name: Revelation 10:7
verse: But in the days of the voice of the seventh angel, when he shall begin to sound, the mystery of God should be finished, as he hath declared to his servants the prophets.

name: Revelation 10:8
verse: And the voice which I heard from heaven spake unto me again, and said, Go and take the little book which is open in the hand of the angel which standeth upon the sea and upon the earth.

name: Revelation 10:9
verse: And I went unto the angel, and said unto him, Give me the little book. And he said unto me, Take it, and eat it up; and it shall make thy belly bitter, but it shall be in thy mouth sweet as honey.

name: Revelation 10:10
verse: And I took the little book out of the angel's hand, and ate it up; and it was in my mouth sweet as honey: and as soon as I had eaten it, my belly was bitter.

name: Revelation 10:11
verse: And he said unto me, Thou must prophesy again before many peoples, and nations, and tongues, and kings.

name: Revelation 11:1
verse: And there was given me a reed like unto a rod: and the angel stood, saying, Rise, and measure the temple of God, and the altar, and them that worship therein.

name: Revelation 11:2
verse: But the court which is without the temple leave out, and measure it not; for it is given unto the Gentiles: and the holy city shall they tread under foot forty and two months.

name: Revelation 11:3
verse: And I will give power unto my two witnesses, and they shall prophesy a thousand two hundred and threescore days, clothed in sackcloth.

name: Revelation 11:4
verse: These are the two olive trees, and the two candlesticks standing before the God of the earth.

name: Revelation 11:5
verse: And if any man will hurt them, fire proceedeth out of their mouth, and devoureth their enemies: and if any man will hurt them, he must in this manner be killed.

name: Revelation 11:6
verse: These have power to shut heaven, that it rain not in the days of their prophecy: and have power over waters to turn them to blood, and to smite the earth with all plagues, as often as they will.

name: Revelation 11:7
verse: And when they shall have finished their testimony, the beast that ascendeth out of the bottomless pit shall make war against them, and shall overcome them, and kill them.

name: Revelation 11:8
verse: And their dead bodies shall lie in the street of the great city, which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also our Lord was crucified.

name: Revelation 11:9
verse: And they of the people and kindreds and tongues and nations shall see their dead bodies three days and an half, and shall not suffer their dead bodies to be put in graves.

name: Revelation 11:10
verse: And they that dwell upon the earth shall rejoice over them, and make merry, and shall send gifts one to another; because these two prophets tormented them that dwelt on the earth.

name: Revelation 11:11
verse: And after three days and an half the Spirit of life from God entered into them, and they stood upon their feet; and great fear fell upon them which saw them.

name: Revelation 11:12
verse: And they heard a great voice from heaven saying unto them, Come up hither. And they ascended up to heaven in a cloud; and their enemies beheld them.

name: Revelation 11:13
verse: And the same hour was there a great earthquake, and the tenth part of the city fell, and in the earthquake were slain of men seven thousand: and the remnant were affrighted, and gave glory to the God of heaven.

name: Revelation 11:14
verse: The second woe is past; and, behold, the third woe cometh quickly.

name: Revelation 11:15
verse: And the seventh angel sounded; and there were great voices in heaven, saying, The kingdoms of this world are become the kingdoms of our Lord, and of his Christ; and he shall reign for ever and ever.

name: Revelation 11:16
verse: And the four and twenty elders, which sat before God on their seats, fell upon their faces, and worshipped God,

name: Revelation 11:17
verse: Saying, We give thee thanks, O Lord God Almighty, which art, and wast, and art to come; because thou hast taken to thee thy great power, and hast reigned.

name: Revelation 11:18
verse: And the nations were angry, and thy wrath is come, and the time of the dead, that they should be judged, and that thou shouldest give reward unto thy servants the prophets, and to the saints, and them that fear thy name, small and great; and shouldest destroy them which destroy the earth.

name: Revelation 11:19
verse: And the temple of God was opened in heaven, and there was seen in his temple the ark of his testament: and there were lightnings, and voices, and thunderings, and an earthquake, and great hail.

name: Revelation 12:1
verse: And there appeared a great wonder in heaven; a woman clothed with the sun, and the moon under her feet, and upon her head a crown of twelve stars:

name: Revelation 12:2
verse: And she being with child cried, travailing in birth, and pained to be delivered.

name: Revelation 12:3
verse: And there appeared another wonder in heaven; and behold a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and seven crowns upon his heads.

name: Revelation 12:4
verse: And his tail drew the third part of the stars of heaven, and did cast them to the earth: and the dragon stood before the woman which was ready to be delivered, for to devour her child as soon as it was born.

name: Revelation 12:5
verse: And she brought forth a man child, who was to rule all nations with a rod of iron: and her child was caught up unto God, and to his throne.

name: Revelation 12:6
verse: And the woman fled into the wilderness, where she hath a place prepared of God, that they should feed her there a thousand two hundred and threescore days.

name: Revelation 12:7
verse: And there was war in heaven: Michael and his angels fought against the dragon; and the dragon fought and his angels,

name: Revelation 12:8
verse: And prevailed not; neither was their place found any more in heaven.

name: Revelation 12:9
verse: And the great dragon was cast out, that old serpent, called the Devil, and Satan, which deceiveth the whole world: he was cast out into the earth, and his angels were cast out with him.

name: Revelation 12:10
verse: And I heard a loud voice saying in heaven, Now is come salvation, and strength, and the kingdom of our God, and the power of his Christ: for the accuser of our brethren is cast down, which accused them before our God day and night.

name: Revelation 12:11
verse: And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb, and by the word of their testimony; and they loved not their lives unto the death.

name: Revelation 12:12
verse: Therefore rejoice, ye heavens, and ye that dwell in them. Woe to the inhabiters of the earth and of the sea! for the devil is come down unto you, having great wrath, because he knoweth that he hath but a short time.

name: Revelation 12:13
verse: And when the dragon saw that he was cast unto the earth, he persecuted the woman which brought forth the man child.

name: Revelation 12:14
verse: And to the woman were given two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness, into her place, where she is nourished for a time, and times, and half a time, from the face of the serpent.

name: Revelation 12:15
verse: And the serpent cast out of his mouth water as a flood after the woman, that he might cause her to be carried away of the flood.

name: Revelation 12:16
verse: And the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened her mouth, and swallowed up the flood which the dragon cast out of his mouth.

name: Revelation 12:17
verse: And the dragon was wroth with the woman, and went to make war with the remnant of her seed, which keep the commandments of God, and have the testimony of Jesus Christ.

name: Revelation 13:1
verse: And I stood upon the sand of the sea, and saw a beast rise up out of the sea, having seven heads and ten horns, and upon his horns ten crowns, and upon his heads the name of blasphemy.

name: Revelation 13:2
verse: And the beast which I saw was like unto a leopard, and his feet were as the feet of a bear, and his mouth as the mouth of a lion: and the dragon gave him his power, and his seat, and great authority.

name: Revelation 13:3
verse: And I saw one of his heads as it were wounded to death; and his deadly wound was healed: and all the world wondered after the beast.

name: Revelation 13:4
verse: And they worshipped the dragon which gave power unto the beast: and they worshipped the beast, saying, Who is like unto the beast? who is able to make war with him?

name: Revelation 13:5
verse: And there was given unto him a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies; and power was given unto him to continue forty and two months.

name: Revelation 13:6
verse: And he opened his mouth in blasphemy against God, to blaspheme his name, and his tabernacle, and them that dwell in heaven.

name: Revelation 13:7
verse: And it was given unto him to make war with the saints, and to overcome them: and power was given him over all kindreds, and tongues, and nations.

name: Revelation 13:8
